Walked to the baseball stadium for a game, had a great reception on the rooftop pool deck, and took a group of about 20 out each night for cheap dinners in the gaslamp. Highly recommend Solamar for meetings or personal travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Excellent Room”
Reviews.Author: Charles B
Reviews.Content: My stay at Solamar was great! I got this hotel on Priceline with no real expectations, but was pleasantly surprised. I can honestly say that when I travel to San Diego for work or play I will be staying there again. It was a great room for the price and right in the heart of downtown. The rooms are very tidy and I love the boutique hotel atmosphere. The pool and outside bar area are a great place to hangout with reasonably priced drinks. The staff was truly wonderful and always ready to help or offer advice on where to eat. The only reason I did not give the place full 5â€™s is that the cost to park, at the hotel is outrageous. Try and find a place a block or two away for less than half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Floatie
Reviews.Content: Great location to everything. Can walk to all the restaurants, bars and a shopping mall in the Gaslamp District. The room was very nicely decorated with a very comfortable bed. The only thing I didn't like was the bathroom sink. It looked very trendy: square, above counter mounted, but so shallow the water went everywhere and trying to shave was very challenging. Free internet if you sign up with Kimpton. The pool area on the 4th floor rooftop was very nice with a great bar area and lots of seating. The hotel had a complementary wine hour in the lobby area which was a very nice touch. My only complaint would be the valet only parking at $36/night. Very expensive. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Harmony177
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just a couple of blocks from Petco Park, restaurants, bars, and shopping in gaslamp dictrict. Room is a nice size, bathroom nicely upgraded, pool area has a great bar and view. Also the hotel offers free coffe in the morning and has a wine hour every night. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel great location but avoid rip off mini bar!”
Reviews.Author: SteveM114
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and room in perfect location. Front desk staff polished and smart. Only downside was that Jose in particular really didn't want to do any more than the bare minimum for us when asked to, which was a shame as it tainted our view of the hotel. Kimpton are guilty of shamelessly ripping their customers off with a 12 dollar charge for 2 bottles of water left in our room. Would love to hear them justify that, but that's a minor point and all in all this is a good hotel with a nice pool area too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DB629
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. The location is in the Gaslamp District which is all restaurants, shops and pubs/bars and has a great atmosphere. I had rented a car because I thought it would be the best way to get around, but we walked to lunch and dinner every day. The breakfast place across the street is definitely worth going to as well! PetCo Park is only a few blocks away, and even though it was convenient to drive to the zoo and for a day trip to La Jolla, we could definitely have gotten away with walking or cabs. If you do rent a car, there is a lot across the street from the hotel that charges a little less than the hotel parking fees. As for the hotel itself, I loved the design of the rooms and the common areas. Everything is very modern and up to date.The atmosphere is very comfortable and welcoming. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. The complimentary wine hour was something I had never seen before and thought was great. The pool area was very nice as well. I loved this hotel so much that I booked a room for a night out in the city at home (NYC) just for fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: zonemanDanville
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Solamar during a business trip in early September. This is a classy little hotel that lives up to Kimpton standards. They have a free wine tasting every night between 5 and 6 p.m. They also have a terrific restaurant on premesis, and a nice area in the lobby for reading the paper or enjoying your wine. They also have free coffeee each morning. The rooms are nice, and if you join their loyalty club, the wifi is free. The room I stayed in was very clean, had a well stocked refreshment center, and the bed was great. The corner suites are especially nice. They have a nice rooftop bar on the 4th floor, which is a terrific people watching spot. The staff was friendly and courteous, and Angel at the front desk was especially helpful. I would recommend this hotel for either a baseball trip to visit Petco, or simply for business. It is adjacent to the Gaslamp district, and is directly across the street from the Palm restaurant. The hotel is pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jbberkeleytraveler
Reviews.Content: My husbaand and I traveled with our 2 year old daughter to stay at the Solamar last Thanksgiving. It was relatively quiet, but upon check in we discovered that the suite we had reserved was unavailable. I was concerned, but the staff person who helped us offered a much larger room as an upgrade (no separate sleeping area, but a very spacious room with an outdoor sitting area adjacent to the pool (but without direct pool access). This ended up being helpful, as our daughter had somewhere to run around, though we did miss having a separate room for a sleeping area. Kimpton gives (or at least, used to give) a 50% discount on parking to people driving hybrid vehicles, so this was a nice plus for us. The location was very handy: there's a great pizza restaurant a few blocks away, as well as a small playground near the ball park. One downside to being in the room we received was that, as s room with a view of the pool, it was also a room with a view (and the sounds) of the bar/lounge at the pool, which could get a bit noisy on nights when there were lots of people partying. (We were warned of this, and told that it probably wouldn't be that bad on a holiday weekend. It wasn;t intolerable, but it was noticeable). Overall, we would go back!

Reviews.Title: “first time visit; I would go again”
Reviews.Author: scottybod
Reviews.Content: right in the center of the Gaslamp district. Friendly, efficient staff; lovely room; VERY comfortable bed; tiny workout area; EXPENSIVE parking, but it was almost as bad in external parking facilities; Pool area gorgeous;

Reviews.Title: “Excellent San Diego Gaslamp Quarter Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Seamo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Solamar for a two-night stay and enjoyed both the Gaslamp Quarter location and the hotel itself. Having handed over car parking duties to the valet (at $36 pn the one irritation with the Solamar, to be honest) check-in went smooothly & professionally and we made our way up to our room on the 9th floor, high up with a view as requested as part of the online booking. We both thought the room was first-rate, with a lovely & comfortable large bed, great decor, good quality furniture & fittings, plus a large, clean, well-finished bathroom. No coffee maker but there was a fridge and the wi-fi internet was quick and easily accessed. We didn't eat in the hotel but we did avail ourselves of the wine reception on the first evening and it was lovely to sit in the beautiful lobby area in comfortable arm-chairs drinking a couple of glasses of very acceptable Californian wine. The hotel location is great for the restaurants on Fifth Avenue a short walk away and we also made the short stroll to admire Petco Park on the final morning. Driving up to Balboa Park was also easy. In summary, we enjoyed our stay at the Solamar - Margot liked the 'ambience' - and should we return to San Diego in the future we would probably stay here again, perhaps even catch a Padres game!

Reviews.Title: “Nice large hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trav34268
Reviews.Content: I'm not usually a fan of large chain hotels-however Solamar did not disappoint. It doesn't have the small touches of a boutique hotel but I couldn't fault it for what it did offer. It's right central in the middle of downtown sunny San Diego. Plenty of restaurants and bars surrounding it. Plenty of shops surround it as well. Most of the tourist stuff is within a very short taxi ride, such as the ZOO and seaworld. The tourist stuff in downtown such as the USS midway ect is only a short walk away. Petco park (MBL) is half a block walk and a great way to spend a relaxing night watching the Padres. The front desk staff were helpful and polite. The room its self was massive. It was clean and spacious. There was wine tasting every night. The only down side to the hotel is the noise from the pool area. I'm not talking about during the day, but the night. On a Friday and Saturday night it can really kick off down there. We were on the 7th floor overlooking the pool and it was very noisy with loud music, people yelling and screaming ect...however we were aware this was going to be an issue after reading all the other posts on trip advisor and accepted it. If you have small kids or hate noise you may want to request a room that doesn't overlook the pool. Overall great hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: nicebizguy
Reviews.Content: One of the more disappointing hotel stays I have experienced in some time. Front office staff , one in particular, was just plain rude. They forgot to give us our Package gift, room service was served on our bed as there was no table in the room nor did they bring one in... and we received absolutely nothing in terms of compensation from management other than a $50 credit for what was supposed to be part of our package.. and which we paid for by purchasing the package..thus , nothing. ...on the good side, location is good but I would not want to be there during a baseball game..it is so close I cannot imagine the noise factor during a night game ... and the pool, albeit pretty small, is a cool scene... There are so many other options in SD, I just would not chose this one in the future...sorry..

Reviews.Title: “Gas in the Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: Golfman44
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Solamar in the Gaslamp district in San Diego is an absolute gem. Fairly priced, nicely decorated, and great ambiance. Wine and light fare at 5 O'clock are an outstanding touch.

Reviews.Title: “Offered more than Hotel Del, except the views”
Reviews.Author: beach2mountains
Reviews.Content: Stayed here then transferred to the Del for a few days. The Solamar has hard working employees, good location, great rooms with lots of space, lots of amenities, great bathroom, jacuzzi tub in the room, excellent pool/ bar area on the roof, and an excellent in hotel restaurant. We found the room to be nicer, and offer more than an oceanfront room at the Del, though the view, of course, cannot compare.Every request made was handled perfectly, with the special, sometimes quirky, touch that a Klimpton Hotel usually provides. We had a minor issue with the room temp and asked it to be fixed. When we returned to the room the temp was great, and the maintenance man left a chocolate wrench and a personal note that the problem was fixed. This place provided all of this with a room base rate below 170, a fraction of the Del.

Reviews.Title: “Family and pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: apn2596
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here while in town for a wedding in Aug. The hotel was very nice, clean, centrally located near the Convention Center. The lobby felt luxurious. The staff was friendly and helpful. Best of all was the hotel's pet friendly policy, which allowed us to take our puppy with us. Overall a great hotel. We would come back to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A must for Dog-Friendly service and personal attention”
Reviews.Author: MalibuHarley
Reviews.Content: The Kimpton chain is a great independent chain where they always go the extra step, but Hotel Solamar in San Diego set the new bar for customer service. I spent a weekend with my partner at the hotel, along with our 2 dogs--Roxy (a 38 lb english bulldog, and La Biscochita, a 3 lb mex chihuahua). When we arrived, there was a "Welcome VIP Guests: Roxy and Biscochita sign posted outside the hotel at the main entrance. If there was ever a question of feeling welcome, or how will the hotel accept my pet, you can table the question. The hotel was amazing, the pool scene a blast, the lobby wine hour at 5pm was super ( AS WAS THE WINE!!), and the rooms were spotless. They staff at the desk was terrific, and directed us to dog-friendly restaurants, and offered maps and directions to all sites we chose to visit. This hotel has it all!!

Reviews.Title: “early Sept visit”
Reviews.Author: MBKNJ
Reviews.Content: Just spent Tues - Fri here with mixed reviews. Generally positive. The power outage occurred Thurs afternoon and the hotel staff did a very good job under the circumstances. On the more mundane front, room wasn't ready at 2:00 pm, pool area had what looked like the previous evening's drinks residue in the late afternoon, no service at the pool whatsoever (called begging for water and or ice/tea and several pitchers were finally brought to the bar, but no other service), no light at all at the desk area and very dim light in the bath, no soap - only large refillable bottles of gel (a purely personal dislike admittedly), used water glasses not removed by housekeeping, greyish thin towels in bath. Bed needs more and better pillows. All minor issues, but all detract from an overall positive experience and could be quickly cured by an attentive management team.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelwriter1usa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very beautiful and in a good location down town.The problem with the restaurant was the number of working ladies (very attaractive and well dressed), that appeared to drop in looking for customers. We mentioned it to the manager and he ignored us completely which left us with a very negative vibe even though the food, service and beverages were excellent.The pool area in the evening was used almost exclusively for socializing by the young up and coming business professionals of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pjvmorgan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights - the room was great, and the staff were very friendly. It's also right in the heart of downtown - a 2 minute walk and you're in the gaslamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location, Good Price -One Issue”
Reviews.Author: travelbatty
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would say this hotel was good. The customer service at all the Kimpton Hotels are usually great. The location of this hotel is really good and the rooms are pretty nice and spacious. I did complain about an issue though. The issue was the bed was made with a top sheet and a duvet without a duvet cover. It's pretty odd for a hotel to not have duvet covers on their duvets. The issue was also the duvet was visibly stained. When you go to a hotel, you do not want to see stained bedding! I called housekeeping and they rudely told me that the hotel was out of blankets. What hotel runs out of blankets? When I brought it up at checkout the manager did discount my stay and was very apologetic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, stayed an extra night..”
Reviews.Author: DrJMacQ
Reviews.Content: Booked at the last minute via a quick search on the internet...turned out to be a really great hotel. Staff were excellent really helpful and genuine, got an upgrade when we checked in and liked the hotel so much we decided to stay an extra night! Didn't have breakfast in the hotel as the location is perfect, a lot of cafes, bars and restaurants on the doorstep. Had room service one night which was disappointing (value and taste not so great) but apart from that it truly was a top hotel! Good mini-bar, super clean, big rooms, comfortable bed, good for business and vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would go back in heart beat”
Reviews.Author: Harvey_Ellie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good. Great location in the gas lamp quarter which has loads of great bars and great restaurants. The room itself was very clean, large and very modern. If you want great service, great location and a very reasonably priced hotel this is for you. The breakfast at the broken yolk a few doors down the street was amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: PickyglobetrotterUk
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean and stylish. Great location, 10 mins walk to conference centre, 10 mins into main gas lamp area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Solamar - would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: leighhouston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Solamar with our two young children and my mother-in-law for a three-night San Diego visit. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay. The hotel is clean and well-appointed. Although I was initially a bit skeptical about its location upon pulling up to the hotel (it faces a not-so-attractive parking lot), I quickly changed my mind. It's a short walk to all major attractions in the Gaslamp quarter... something that comes in very handy when you're pulling along two small kids. Our room wasn't ready until well past check-in time, which was initially annoying. Luckily, my mother-in-law's room was ready to go so we had somewhere to relax while we waited. We stayed in a King suite that faced Petco stadium, and my mother-in-law stayed in a King room facing the pool. The King suite was phenomenal for a family - there were large flat screens and DVD players in both the bedroom and in the adjoining room where the kids stayed. Although our suite was very quiet, my mother-in-law commented that her room was noisy at night. Although there was a wedding at the hotel that night, the noise issue seems to arise fairly frequently based on past TripAdvisor reviews. If we return, I will be sure to request a room on the quiet side of the hotel to avoid the noise issue. The pool area was well-appointed and had a hip, twenty-something vibe. Fortunately for my pool-loving kids, they always felt welcome and there were often other kids swimming along with them in the pool. It was a great place to relax at the end of a busy day. We also loved the free wine reception each evening - a great feature. The biggest standout out about this hotel was the employees - they were phenomenal. The front desk was always there to help, and they were great at giving us tips for family-friendly restaurants in the area (definitely try the Broken Yolk cafe a block away for breakfast - but get there early on the weekend if you want to avoid a wait). The valet guys were particularly exceptional - incredibly friendly and helpful. One day, my four year-old daughter was skipping up the front walkway back into the hotel. One of the valets saw her, came out from behind the desk and skipped with her to the front door to open it for her - it made her (and my) day. Great guys. I wouldn't hesitate to return to Hotel Solamar or to recommend it here. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bring some Ambien if you want some sleep”
Reviews.Author: Karen P
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay here for our first trip to San Diego because of the photos on-line (cool decor) & the location. Our reservation was for 5 nights but we checked-out after 3 because we couldn't take the pounding noise of what sounded like raves (on weeknights?) until after 2:00am. One of the parties was at the hotel next door with the Buddha on the roof; not sure if the others were coming from Hotel Solamar poolside lounge or somewhere else but it was close enough to cause our headboard to vibrate. We didn't complain but we thought when we checked-out 2 days early they would ask how our stay was or ask why we were leaving earlier than planned but they didn't ask. With taxes & parking we paid almost $1,000 for 3 nights of this insanity. The decor & location of this hotel did not disappoint but if you choose to stay here bring sleeping pills & ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Very busy area, buzzy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edsmum984
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a great start here - they had got the reservation wrong so we had to sort this out via the UK before we arrived, and when we arrived one of our rooms wasn't ready for an hour and a half. They did however credit us $50 for this and I appreciated that. The valet guys are fantastic. The reception staff are charming but stretched (this was the weekend tho so that might explain it). Rooms are comfy if not massive, beds are exceptional. The hotel has a hip, buzzy vibe and the Gaslamp quarter is very busy which was a bit of a shock to us - with two kids and after a long drive, Saturday night in the quarter is a bit of a culture shock. But we found a great sports-bar type place attached to Nicky Rotten's (?) which did us a great family meal. If you're into partying (and probably don't have kids although ours seemed to get used to it pretty quickly!) this hotel would be a blast to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER GREAT KIMPTON HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: QUEENIE_ELLE
Reviews.Content: In January 2011 I went on a Friends & Family vacation on Amtrak from San Francisco all the way to Rosamar, Rosarito Beach, Baja. Along the way I stayed at: The Huntley in Santa Monica, my step-daughter's, THE SOLAMAR, friend's in Rosamar, the Marriott Resort at Laguna Hills and The Hollywood Roosevelt. It was a grand adventure! I LOVE TRAVELING BY AMTRAK........ I earned over 2 MILLION MILES with American Airlines, all butt miles as I traveled 3 times a month for over 20 years......... Now, I go to the airport when I want to! Of all the hotel stays, THE SOLOMAR was the best. I think the room was around $125.00 plus tax. The size, decor, amenities and staff were the best. The room was really nicely decorated in a lush, comfortable contemporary fasion. Even the robe was special. It was an animal print....zebra, tiger, a la the San Diego Zoo. Their restaurant was very nice with very delicious breakfast choices. It was large, spacious and airy. Accommodating staff earned multiple stars for attentive, friendly service. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. Easy walking distance to hot spots, great trans to zoo and Globe Theater. Nice cafes fro brekkies, lunch and dinner. Shopping is very good too and close to FedEx for less expensive computer use.

Reviews.Title: “The wife loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ronc4109
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Solamar while visiting San Diego to attend my nephews Marine Basic Training graduation ceremony. Wanted to surprise my wife by staying at the Solamar.....good decision, she/we really enjoyed it! Staff extremely accomadating, offering the complimentary wine even though we were a late evening check-in, past the normal wine hour. Room is spacious, great view of the Padres ballpark. (Would be great venue if your attending the game) Rooftop bar and pool area provides a unique setting for after dinner cocktails, visiting with friends. Grabbed a coffee from the complimentary breakfast bar on our way out! Will definitiely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: heiditrekking
Reviews.Content: The manager's reception was very nice! The hotel is located downtown near all the restaurants and bars. Lots of great options! On Friday/Saturday nights, the streets were lined with young people going out on the town. Staff at the hotel were great and the rooms were nice, clean and quiet. Of course you will need a rental car to get to the beaches. I like the Kimpton chain of hotels. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I'd you're really sure you want to stay in the Gaslamp Quarter and willing to sacrifice Sleep for location, go ahead and stay at”
Reviews.Author: ifjewel
Reviews.Content: Bottom line, Hotel Solamar was not a great choice for us. We were in SD to run the AFC half marathon and were unfortunately staying in a room next door to a wedding party. Nothing could be done to quiet the crowd. The hotel did comp us the night, which was nice of them. I chose the hotel because I love their pet policy and their Fire and Sky resort in AZ. Solamar is no Fire and Sky. As a downtown hotel, it lacks the same grounds and amenities. Service was ok. We were stunned to find that the gong rate for parking was $36 per night and were told by one valet that they would be really busy on Sunday, when we were checking out, due to a ballgame. Not sure what he expected us to do about that. Again, it is the location. If you aren't in the Gaslamp to party, I'd recommend another area and another hotel. If you are there to run a race, seriously consider another.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego's Finest”
Reviews.Author: Colin C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Solamar during our week long stay in San Diego. We were made to feel very welcome on our arrival our room was not ready for us so we were directed to the pool area and given vouchers for free drinks whilst we waited for our room. We were initially offered rooms on the 4th floor which is the same level as the pool which also is the bar area The staff were quite forth coming in informing me that it could get a bit noisy in the evenings especially at the weekends, so we opted to change to a room on the 7th floor overlooking the pool/bar area and noise was not a problem at all. The Solamar is set in the historic Gaslamp area of San Diego with plenty of restaurants and bars in the area in addition to the hotels facilities. The prices in the areas vary the Old Spaghetti House offered great value for money on the higher price side Donavans Prime Seafood was expensive but first class dinning for breakfast in addition to the hotel try the Broken Yoke one block down. Rooms at the Solamar were comfortable free coffee was available in the lobby in the mornings with water and juices at other times. Parking is the main draw back in the area there is some public parking in the area as well as some on street however overnight parking was not readily available and where it was this was expensive so the $36 a night valet parking was reasonable value for hotel guests. The valet parking guys were friendly and helpful and always asked if you needed any directions when handing over your vehicle. The hotel offered a small pool area which in addition to sun loungers there was also a few cabanas available. So the big question is would I stay there again yes I would and would I recommend the Solamar to family and friends the answer to that is yes again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: HA20
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the end of our holiday to California. It has a lovely interior and as soon as you walk in you feel that you are in a decent hotel. The room was very clean and felt more like a bedroom in your own home than a hotel room - if I could have got the bed in my suitcase I would have done! We ate in the restaurant on the first night. The food was good although perhaps a tad overpriced. We did have fantastic service there though. The waiter who served us was really friendly and chatty. On the next night we went to an Asian restaurant recommended by the hotel although I forget the name (began with R and is on the hotel's list). The food there was lovely and wonderful value. We paid for this hotel as part of a package and so I'm not completely sure what we paid, but I do know it was the most expensive out of all of the hotels we stayed in in California. I suspect we paid more for this hotel than we have paid before for equivalent standard hotels, but then they probably know that they can get away with this. By the way, I didn't get any Aveda products! Feel well hard done by! Overall, a good, but not outstanding hotel. Have stayed in better and have had better value for money before.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Dominic37
Reviews.Content: Just returned and had a great time! The room was big and very comfortable for the 3 of us. The pool was fantastic. Yes, it was busy and full of young 'trendy' people but this did not prevent us from using the pool and poolside bar. Our son had other youngsters to play with and they were warmly welcomed around the pool area. ALL staff at the hotel were very friendly, polite and could not be more helpful! The location of this hotel was perfect................right in the centre of the Gaslamp quarter..................ideal for all attractions. Would very much recommend!! We didn't use the restaurant, spa or fitness centre so cannot comment on these.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Poliwhirl
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at this hotel but came away just satisfied rather than excited or overly pleased. First impressions were not good, the front desk staff couldn't get his pc to work and was more interested in taking a call rather than completing my check-in which i really didn't appreciate after an 11hr flight from the UK and all i wanted was to get to my room. Room was OK, nothing special, i had booked online a virtuoso suite and now realise, having just looked at the hotel website that I was DOWNgraded! I got a deluxe guest room with 2 queen beds for the same price! Valet car parking is expensive but you can park in an open lot reasonably cheaply directly opposite the hotel. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as it was not included in the room rate preferring to find a diner in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KellyN
Reviews.Content: We recently spent on night at the Hotel Solamar and wished we could have spent 7. Where to start? The stylish, hip design made us wish we could re-decorate our house at home. The staff were fantastic (especially the bartender by the pool and the front desk). I challenge anyone to find a better rooftop pool and lounge. So relaxing!!! The location couldn't be better - right in the heart of the gaslamp district. We were a bit concerned about the noise outside of the hotel because of the night life location, but our fears were not realized. We couldn't hear a thing The evening wine reception was a lovely surprise. The parking is very, very expensive - $36.00 per night. I don't know if that is standard for the city, but I expected to pay a lot. We had a great breakfast next door at the San Diego chain The Broken Yolk. Good food - great price. We loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not 4 * standard”
Reviews.Author: Lin_Paul18
Reviews.Content: we styed here on the last leg of our honeymoon in november 2010. My biggest issue with this hotel was that House Keeping was unacceptable. On 3 occasions over our 5 night stay we had left our room early morning and retured 4/5 pm and room was still not serviced, no clean towels. i complained to reception twice the second time this happened before it was eventually cleaned. This was not a cheap hotel to stay in so i expected at much higher standard. Also the pool size bar is rented out for private parties and much of the seats are closed off to hotel guests for this time. I didnt find the reception staff very friendly, talked to other staff while checking us in and hardly paying attention to what he was doing. Location is good and breakfast was nice. had dinner one night, it was only ok. I would not recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Here For Comic Con”
Reviews.Author: Deargoodbye
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for Comic Con because we saw a great rate on their website. We had a great stay! The room was cozy and nicely decorated. We ended up on the 10th floor and while plenty of parties were going on at the hotel, we didn't hear one sound in our room. We were able to check out the pool a few times and it's a very nice area. The pool was perfect temperature wise and there was plenty of lounge chairs. It was a nice little place to relax. The staff was great as well. Everyone we ran into was nothing but helpful and always very friendly and wearing a smile. We really did feel like royalty when we stayed here! We had free wifi since we joined the loyalty program and it was pretty good. It did seem slow at times but that's expected. We didn't have car which meant not having to shell out for parking. Honestly we didn't even need a car! We could walk to everything, including the convention center. If you're staying here for Comic Con or any other convention center event, skip on the car! You'll save yourself a good bit of money! We ordered room service one night and it was fast and tasty! The mini bar and fridge were well stocked but of course a little pricey. All in all, we'd stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love it, almost did”
Reviews.Author: Bigdada64
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights during the last week of July 2011. Some things great, a few things need some work. Pros: Great people working valet, desk etc. Half priced valet parking if driving a hybrid car. Very nice morning and happy hour setup in lobby. Great location to lots of activities, food, drink,nightlife right outside the hotel, small but cozy pool area with heated pool, nice loungechairs, towels etc Cons: rooms are adequate but lacking any drawer space. some of the bathrooms favor style over function, ic ouldn't use the sink without splashing everything on the vanity. Lastly, I joined the Kimpton loyalty program with promises of free wifi. Over my entire stay, could never get it working, including using their free sign on for guests. Not a huge deal, but with their business center outsourced to a private company, you have to pay for any computer time beyond printing boarding passes. That's kind of weak

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: omd114
Reviews.Content: Stayed in San Diego for a long weekend and needed a hotel close to the convention center. Hotel Solamar was it and I couldn't have done better. We had a suite and it was perfect. The hotel is in the gaslamp quarter, so easy access to all the restaurants and a minute walk to the convention center. The pool on the fourth floor is a bit small but who needs a pool when you have the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “adequate short stay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Siriusguy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Solamar seems best-suited for a briefer stay in San Diego's Gas Lamp Quarter, such as for a baseball game or two at Petco Park, which is walking distance. Our room seemed comfortable enough, but the closet was small, and there was virtually no drawer space, not really compensated for by the overly prominent mini-bar. The room lacked an in-room coffee maker, so every morning meant a hike down to the lobby to get coffee. DO ask for a room on Sixth Avenue....IF you enjoy late night subwoofer rumblings from the late night dance club across the street! Anyway, the next time we go to San Diego County, likely we'll choose somewhere in North County.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Solamar in San Diego is a class act!”
Reviews.Author: John_Rhodes_55
Reviews.Content: Hotel Solamar in San Diego is a class act! This place is very classy and comfortable. The rooms and bathrooms are luxurious! Very convenient to food, shopping and nightlife. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth the Money!”
Reviews.Author: welzeinz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of the Gaslamp District and is easy walking distance to tons of restaurants, shopping, Petco Park, the Convention Center, and many other attractions. The room was clean and beautifully decorated and we had a great view of the downtown area. Breakfast in the restaurant was great. Make sure you hang around (about 5:00 PM, I think) for the complimentary wine hour.

Reviews.Title: “American hotel with an Asian Touch”
Reviews.Author: PoipuKapele
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Solamar in May during a business trip. The decorum was unique and very striking - beautiful Asian accents and modern angles yet very comfortable and inviting. The location was excellent - easy access to many diverse restaurants. LOUNGEsix on the fourth floor was great during the day by the pool and a fun venue for entertaining clients into the evening especially since fireworks were provided by Petco Park after the baseball game.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: notveryportable
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights and it was absolutely wonderful. The staff was fantastic and the room was first rate. It was unseasonably hot, and every morning their was copious free hot AND ICED coffee - lovely. Housekeeping did a wonderful job daily. My only complaint is that the pool area appears to be a big hangout for San Diego's beautiful people. It is the only place to get a drink in the hotel unless you are eating dinner and you can't take drinks back to your room! This seems ridiculous. To stay in a hotel and be "trapped" at the pool if you want a drink is just wrong. Otherwise, fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: GetAwayWhenICan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband, mom and 1 1/2 year old daughter. We were going to Sea World during the day and we wanted to make a weekend out of it. We checked in about 7pm and the valet was very helpful. Hotel is well kept and the staff was friendly. I booked a suite because we were going to need a portable crib and my Mom was staying with us. The room was awfully tiny for a "suite". It did have sliding doors that separating the "living area" with a pull out couch from the bedroom area. It worked out fine in the end, it was just tiny. We went straight downstairs because my daughter was starving. We walked into JSix without a reservation. There were plenty of tables available and seemed like a really slow evening. They were horrible to us ... I had to ask 4 times before we were finally sat. I had to ask random people walking by for water and bread at least. They finally sent over the hostess with a pitcher of water of which she spilled all over the table (no big deal but she obviously was just the hostess ... poor thing). After not being waited on by an actual waiter we ended up leaving. There are plenty other restaurants to go to in the are ... so just make sure you skip this one. My mom went upstairs with my daughter and ordered them room service which she said was perfect and came quickly. :-) When we went to sleep I could hear club music until the early morning and we were on quite a high floor. Nothing they could do ... that is the part of San Diego I chose to stay in but this is just a heads up. My husband and I woke up early and went downstairs for the free coffee in the lobby and a quick smoke. The valet guy ran around looking for a lighter for us. Very nice ... We went for a swim about 10 am and the pool area was nice but was still a mess from the evening bar/club by the pool thing the night before. Only one staff member was casually putting pillow covers back on. Maybe I shouldn't judge as it was only 10 am. Overall it was a nice stay with nice staff but has really small rooms and a horrible somewhat "attached" restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, rooms and pool in the heart of the Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: AndrewHR
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights for a conference and loved it. Location is right in the middle of the action in the Gaslamp District, the rooms are great and the service excellent. I've never received such a warm welcome and send off from a hotel (thank you Erika!) Even better, the pool and surrounding lounge area is incredible. My only suggestion for improvement would be to add coffee machines and iPod base stations to the rooms (although free coffee, plus a nice selection of free newspapers, are in the lobby every morning). I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Funky rooms and fabulous roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: SBear62
Reviews.Content: The Solamar is a very trendy and funky hotel which I would highly recommend when staying in San Diego. Conveniently located in the gas lamp district, so very close to everything. The rooms are amazingly large and quirky. Great jacuzzi big enough for two and a large walk in shower . We loved our room and the leopard dressing gowns! The terrace and pool are really nice and very happening which you can tell from the clientele. The only downside to this hotel is the somewhat cool service from the bar and restaurant staff. The staff in the entire hotel are very young and it seems there is no manager to run the whole thing which is a real shame as it is a lovely hotel. I have seen these comments before and I just wonder when the management who are never seen are going to act on these comments and employ management staff supervising the reception area, the bar, restaurant and pool areas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful stay, friendliest staff!”
Reviews.Author: KIZ313
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I went for a week to San Diego and stayed at the Hotel Solamar. From the minute we walked in until the minute we regrettably left, it was a wonderful experience. The hotel is in a perfect location to go shopping, out to eat, and out at night. We had a blast. We were greeted every single time we walked into the hotel or out of the hotel by friendly staff members. The hotel was clean and well decorated, and a pleasure to stay at. Of all the hotels I've ever stayed at, this was by FAR the friendliest, most accommodating staff I have ever dealt with from the bartenders at J Six, the Concierge/Front Desk people, to the valet boys. I will never stay anywhere in San Diego ever again and will tell all my friends, family and coworkers to do the same. We loved it so much that after we left to go up north, we turned around and came right back a few days later. Already can't wait to plan my next trip to San Diego/The Solomar!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, in a great location, friendly.”
Reviews.Author: tesseract68
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip (at the convention center), and it was my first time staying in a Kimpton Hotel. Overall I was very pleased--the room decor was very stylish, and the bed very comfortable. Even the bathrobes in the room are stylish (leopard print!). The hotel is centrally located with respect to the Gaslamp, restaurants, shopping, and the convention center, so for this trip it was ideal. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the free coffee in the lobby was a nice touch. It was also great to have free wireless (if you sign up to be a Kimpton member, which is no cost). I can see how this place would be fun for a leisure trip, but even for a business trip it was great. It was also more reasonably priced than the other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mgaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Solamar for four nights in June, 2011. We had requested a quiet room on a pet-free floor and that is just what we got. Our room faced away from the pool and we heard no noise at all. The room itself was large, very nicely furnished with a comfy bed and we were very happy with it. The hotel staff were friendly and the free drinks in the lobby in the afternoon were an added bonus. There was also free coffee in the morning and wine in the evening but we did not have either. We joined Kimpton Hotels and that enabled us to have free internet in the room. The hotel was in a good position for walking to restaurants and I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “The Best and Most Chic Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: surplusmarketing
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kimpton Solamar in San Diego for the 2nd time and it just keep getting better here. I was met with kind, courteous, and attentive valet staff. Check-in at the counter was very helpful, professional, and organized. Though i had to wait for my room, when i received my room at 3pm it was spotless and tidy as usual. This is what one should expect from a 4.5-5 star hotel. The lobby of this hotel is amazing. Rich woods, comfortable chairs and sofas, it felt like home or better. There was free water and spritzers in the lobby, which was refreshing in the San Diego summer heat. However, the hotel lobby and rooms are well air-conditioned, making the Solamar a welcoming oasis from normal life. Katie or Kelsie (i think that was her name) was the nicest hotel clerk i've ever met. These people here will do whatever it takes to make your stay top-notch, leaving nothing to chance. I got to stay in the Master Suite this time, and it was worth every penny. Spa tub next to a window, just when does a hotel have that? The Suites could be larger but the price is already at a value. Affordable, not inexpensive but not expensive at all, considering the total package received. I'm a Kimpton In-Touch member and they give you $10 in room service snacks (it's called the "Honor Bar") so i always deduct $10 from the room price. These gestures by the hotel are nice, and nice needs to always be recognized. I totally recommend this Kimpton above all other Kimptons (although i recommend those too that i've stayed at), and definitely over 99% of all other hotels i've stayed at. The beds are super comfy, everything spotless and chic in the hotel, and there is not a single thing i can find wrong with anything the entire time during both my stays. The Solamar deserves a solid 5-star rating, even though it's considered a 4.5 star hotel. Thank you to all the wonderful staff at the Kimpton Solamar. Best Regards, Don

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Heidi_25_55
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for adults! Easy parking across the street, no need to do expensive vallet. Hotel is pet friendly and we are not "pet people" so we were concerned about that but the dogs present were well in hand and nonintrusive. Beds were comfortable and while we did not partake in the wine tasteing everyone present seemed to have a good time. Great stay, great location, all for a great price!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not kid friendly like they advertise.”
Reviews.Author: aliandluke
Reviews.Content: Staff - friendly and helpful, Jose especially helpful on our check in, when he proceeded to explain the room that I had booked was nothing like what I had been told on the phone! He organsied a room change and I was given credit for the difference. Wendy organised transport to Legoland for us, although I would not recommend the "limousine" company that was used. Beverley's Limousines, the car was in poor condition, seat belts did not work and we had 4 kids with us, he drove with hands off the steering wheel mostly, he stopped for coffee and gas on the way, and talked on his cell a lot of the time, whilst counting money!!! Rooms - do not book the choreographer suite if you have children and want a separate sleeping area or want a quiet holiday away, it is noisy, has no bath and is very close to the night club/pool area! It's not really a nightclub but may as well be. The room itself was really nice if you were a young couple away wanting to Party and entertain in your room. We were moved to a Master suite on the 9th level, which is pet free, and it was great. Clean, big even with the sofa bed, massive tub and separate shower. It was still noisy but not as bad, and very tolerable. Pool - too small, and had more of a nightclub atmosphere. Lots of young people wearing next to nothing, drinking and being loud, not suitable for small children. My kids didn't seem to mind, and the guests in the pool didn't seem to mind having my kids splash around them, but it really isn't kid friendly as they suggest. The pool is too small. The staff around the pool were selective in who they seemed to serve, I never once got asked to order a drink or food, even after one day sitting with a menu for over an hour! I was at the pool every day!! This hotel is advertised as completely non smoking, however, one of the rooms that has the terrace overlooking the pool had guests sitting on the terrace smoking! This ruined my time at the pool. Not sure why there was one set of rules for some people and not others. Location - excellent, even with my two young children. On the whole the hotel is great if you want to party, sit by a pool and drink and have late nights.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: artslover
Reviews.Content: I stayed for six nights. I found the king room which overlooked the pool to be very comfortable. A few details I would note: there is no coffee maker in the room, but there is free coffee in the lobby in the morning. There is a refrigerator mini bar as well as other non-refridgerated treats. There were no drawers in the room but there was a shelf in the closet along with a mini safe. If I had to share, perhaps the shelves for my clothing might have been a bit tight. As a Kimpton In Touch member, I had free wifi in the room. There was a work desk and chair and a large chair for lounging. Bathroom was well appointed with Gilchrist & Soames shampoo, conditioner and shower get. There was a magnified makeup mirror and hair dryer. It was kept spotlessly clean during my stay. The room temperature was easy to control. If it got humid and warm while I was out during the day, turning on the fan quickly had it at a very comfortable temperature. The hotel is good with extras like foam pillows because I'm allergic to feathers. Upon request, I was able to have use of a yoga mat and used the yoga videos provided in addition to the pay movies, etc. on the flat screen tv. Free wine is offered in the afternoon along with a non-alcholic beverage (which I didn't sample). The pool area was rather noisy on Friday and Saturday night, and could be heard in the room with the window closed, but not so noisy I didn't fall asleep. The restaurant does not have a huge menu but I found the food reasonably good and service excellent. I did not try the room service dining. The fitness center next to the pool area is very tiny with free weights and a few machines. The business center charges for internet use but printing boarding passes is free. Not being there for pleasure, I was not concerned about the location but it is close to many restaurants, I could walk (40 minutes) to Balboa Park and it is two blocks to the San Diego Padres' ball park.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wzly76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week while attending a conference based at the hotel. The location in the Gaslamp is wonderful--within walking distance of Petco Park, many greatl restaurants, etc. My room was very quiet, and the bed was wonderfully comfortable. My only complaints about the room are that (1) there are no drawers to unpack into (who wants to live out of a suitcase for a week? I ended up stacking clothes on a shelf in the closet), and (2) the lighting is abysmal. The bathrooms are inexcusably dark, and the lighting in the rooms themselves needs improvement. Lighting also was an issue in the lobby area (really dark, not what you expect in SoCal), and the rooms where we had our lectures had inadequate lighting. Kind of depressing, actually. All in all, a pleasant, if not ideal stay. I did enjoy the pool, although on Saturdays and Sundays the clientele and vibe at the pool change completely...it becomes something of a loud meat market, with lots of surgical enhancements parading around in skimpy suits . . . parents were getting their children out of there in a hurry!

Reviews.Title: “What is not to love?”
Reviews.Author: justinw1972
Reviews.Content: We booked through priceline and embarrassed how cheap we got the room. For some reason ended up in corner room with spa bath. I think we drunk more value in free wine than the room cost us. Staff went out of their way to make our stay pleasant... were forever suggesting restaurants... and the pool bar was fantastic... yea pool is on the smaller side... would have been happy to have paid rack rate... and im as old as the previous reveiwer!

Reviews.Title: “The Solamar was a wonderfully charming hotel with the best staff possible.”
Reviews.Author: LedbetterLodge
Reviews.Content: Jose, Ashley & Angel at the front desk were very nice and extremely helpful during our stay. Actually, the entire staff of the Solamar was the best I've ever encountered, The rooms overlooking the pool were beautiful and very clean. I will definitely stay at the Solamar for my next stay in San Diego and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “10! and i don't give them easily”
Reviews.Author: thil83
Reviews.Content: From the valet to the front desk and all service in-between, the staff was outstanding. I was so impressed with this place. All the front desk staff were incredible, with a shout out to Jose... if you don't stay here, you're missing out! Thank you guys for everything!

Reviews.Title: “style over substance”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights on a business trip and had a very mixed experience. Staff was mostly helpful, with one major exception that really hurt our feelings about the place. Room design is not functional. There are two tiny dresser drawers, one of which is stuffed with minibar items. Perhaps the hip young crowd who stays here doesn't wear much in the way of undergarments, since there is no space for them in the furnishings. Closet is configured like a tunnel with the door at one end, leaving a long corridor of clothes between you and the iron and ironing board at the other end. Bathroom lacks towel racks, only one hook by the shower. Hip design should not come at the expense of functionality. Over four nights, we were only able to get the room temperature to stay comfortable once. The other three nights the thermostat reset in the middle of the night and the temperature in our room went up by 8 - 10 degrees leading to overheating under the very thick duvet. These design flaws were annoying, but the attitude of the staff at the pool/bar area was unacceptable. My wife went down to read and relax on the pool deck one morning. After settling into a cozy spot for a while, one of the bar servers came over and asked her to move elsewhere because her chair had been 'reserved.' The pool deck was more than half empty, and the beautiful people showing off their cosmetic enhancements were not asked to relocate. Can't help but conclude that staff discriminates on looks, which requires a plastic surgeon to pass muster in this part of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Take it from a repeat customer, I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: cabogolf19
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Solamar on average once a month. I am a tough hotel guest. I have a whole list of criteria for what constitutes an acceptable room. So much so, my husband is embarrassed to check in with me! The Solamar continues to get it right. A big shout out to Kelsey and Jose who are often working the desk when I check in. San Diego has a myriad of hotel choices. If you like luxury at an affordable price, want to be right in the heart of the gaslamp and crave over-the-top customer service, this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: natalie4654
Reviews.Content: The free wine hour was great...and you're literally one block from Petco Park. Great location for nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: frankieandsandy
Reviews.Content: We arrived a few hours early from a 13 hour flight + 2 hour drive to Hotel Solamar and the staff were brilliant, sending us straight up to our room, rather than have us wait. Much appreciated with 3 kids in tow! Our room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The location was excellent, very close to the stadium and in the Gaslamp District within walking distance to a great selection of restaurants and shops. The hotel pool is very cool, with cabanas and a bar, and great city outlook. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel, we travel often and have high expectations. We'll b back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melleah
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with the Hotel Solomar-- I stayed here for a conference (that was also located at the hotel). The beds are really comfortable, and the room was spacious. I thought it was great that they have a recycle bin in each room. All of the employees were very friendly and the front desk staff had great recommendations for restaurants. The neighborhood is great with lots of things to do within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: lizdwhiz
Reviews.Content: I love my stays at the Hotel Solamar! I am never disappointed. They are eco-friendly, pet-friendly and people friendly! The rooms are nice and chic with excellent linens. They have a hosted wine hour social in the lobby and also a morning gathering with breakfast goodies. The location is awesome and the staff is full of good on- and off- property recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “We love Kimpton hotels!”
Reviews.Author: woodchucker
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed at the Hotel Solamar for three nights in early June and loved it! This is the third Kimpton hotel we have stayed in and frankly, if we have a choice we will always stay in Kimpton hotels wherever we go. The staff was friendly and welcoming, they couldn't do enough for us. The hotel was stylish, loved the decor in the lobby and our room was very nice, had a good view of Petco Park and we could see a giant TV screen at the park which enabled us to watch the game! We had asked for a pet-free room, so we were on the 8th floor (8th and 9th floors reserved for the pet-free rooms). The location couldn't have been better for us to wander around the city on our first visit to San Diego. Lots of restaurants right near there. We almost booked a room in the Hard Rock Hotel instead but I'm glad we didn't as it seemed super noisy and the neighborhood was teeming with people. The Solamar is only a couple of blocks from there but it is quieter and suited us better. We belong to the Kimpton club (or whatever it is called) and got a voucher for $10 for the very nice room minibar. Free iced or hot decaf or regular coffee in the lobby in the morning (good coffee, too!) and a free wine reception every evening, which I also enjoyed.Super comfortable beds, by the way! We loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience in the heart if downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Kklein63
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous stay at Hotel Solamar! From the moment we arrived we felt valued as guests and very well taken care of. After reading some of the views I made sure to call and request a quiet room since my husband and I were going to celebrate our anniversary. They put us on the top floor (no pets) and in a corner room with windows all around! It was absolutely beautiful! They even left a bottle of wine, a box of chocolates, and a hand written note congratulating us on our anniversary, such a nice touch! The only negative thing I have to say is that the tv was not working well while we were there. The shows would constantly cut in and out, but not a big deal to us since we aren't big tv people. Overall we had such a great time and experience! We can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best staff ini town!”
Reviews.Author: dwroesekejr
Reviews.Content: I couldn't imagine a friendlier, more accommodating and all around handsome staff. The hotel is gorgeous, comfortable, and in a prime location but it's the bend-over-backwards staff that truly make the difference!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thirstytraveler_9
Reviews.Content: I came to SD for a 6-day conference, with family. Right from the start, had a good experience. Bell boy was very helpful; checking in was a breeze and, let me tell you, this is a kids friendly hotel. Booth my children got toys from a basket as part of the check in. Next day, I was at my conference, and my little boy was crying around the lobby. My wife told me that one of the front desk men came and asked had them pick toys from the basket again. The hotel has a wine hour from 5-6 pm, and we enjoyed this every day. One of those days, my boy was running around us, and people who were also having a drink. Another front desk lady came and asked me if they had gotten toys when we checked in. Rather than abise the privilege and spoil my children, I tolde her that they indeed had received toys twice, and thanked her. Amazing how friendly staff are; and there may be a reason. I booked my reservation months in advance looking for a reasonable rate. Right after booking it, I come to find out that Kimpton is one of the best (top 3) companies to work for in the San Francisco Bay Area. That explains why staff is very friendly. Wireless is free, only if you become a Kimpton's member, which only takes an application to be completed. You get a discount on parking if you are a AAA member.

Reviews.Title: “Truly enjoyed my first stay at a Kimpton property”
Reviews.Author: Pony_Up
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Masters Suite, which was perfect for a family traveling with two small children. The layout, decor and amenities were very good. The kids LOVED the heated swimming pool, which was perfect because San Diego can be overcast and cool even in June. The staff were very friendly and completely accommodating. We truly enjoyed our stay. The only downside is that Solamar is pricier than what I am used to. An example is $36 USD per day for parking. It is valet and the price does seem to be on par with other properties in San Diego's gaslamp area. If you can get a good deal (off their website or otherwise) or if cost isn't a major concern, then you should be very happy with Solamar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: MSBENNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Solmar for 6 nights, starting on June 2 thru June 8. We had a King Suite for the first 4 nights and loved it. Room 1017. The room was nice and large and super quiet. We never heard anything, except for someone getting ice one night across the hallway. Bed slept wonderful and everything was super clean. Outside our window we could see Petco Park to the right. The one problem we had with this room was the TV signal kept going out. We called the front desk and they sent someone up right then to check on it and said it couldn't be fixed, it was just a bad reception in that room. So after four days of the TV going off in the middle of a program, I asked the front desk to move us. Which they did, but to another King Room, (1027) not a suite. They didn't have another King Pet Free Suite availiable for us. We asked for a Pet Free room when we made reservations at the Solamar and found out that the top two floors at this hotel are Pet Free. And there is only one King Suites on each of these two floors. Anyway, the King Room that they moved us too was just as nice and have a view of the pool area. And yes, the TV worked great. They also discounted our last two night there because of the TV problem. We are really picky about where we stay and we felt the Hotel Solamar meet all our needs. Solamar is on 6th Street and if you walk one street over onto 5th Street you can find every kind of place you could think of too eat, just wonderful. The Broken Yoke is a short walk down 6th Street, wonderful for breakfast and lunch. Get there before 8 am and beat the morning breakfast rush. You can easily walk to Petco Park and the Trolley and buses are always available to you too. Great hotel, great location, and great staff...especailly a Ms. Kelsey at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and service excellent”
Reviews.Author: ToYourHealth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for several days in April. Excellent location close to the convention center and gaslamp quarter. Staff outstanding in every way. Front desk gave us ideas for day trips and arranged an auto rental. Evening wine was a nice perk and staff serving was engaging and pleasant. Good value for the dollar. Hotel restaurant is excellent. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Surfergirl2020
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a last minute flight/hotel package to escape the snow. In the middle of shoveling snow, we decided to stop, go inside and book an SD trip. It was a great decision! The hotel was great, the service was great and it is in a great location- you are about a block away from the main Gaslamp District drag, which was fine with us. The hotel is also dog friendly and it made us wish we had our dog with us! They even had wine and appetizers in the evening in the lobby. We loved the chic beachy (not tacky) decor in the lobby and in the rooms- it was esthetically pleasing. We did not spend much time by the pool, but it was a nice rooftop area- not much of a view, but whatever- your quick ride away from the beach. We also did not eat at the hotel, but there are many great restaurants within walking distance (Cafe 222 for breakfast!). Ask the front desk for a map and for their favorites. This is a great hotel in a great spot and when we come back to SD we will most likely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “It was okay. Not awesome.”
Reviews.Author: taraloftis
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days in late May for a work trip. I was excited about the hotel based on Kimpton's reputation, the hotel promotional images, and word of mouth from my sister and her boyfriend . It was a nice hotel, but maybe my expectations were a bit too high. I feel bad writing all these negatives, but think that people with high expectations should know! Pluses: -Valet team is awesome, friendly and exceptionally helpful -The rooftop pool area is stunning, and if I had time to enjoy it, might have made up for some of the Deltas -Lobby is pretty stylish -The front desk team was quite helpful. I left my Blackberry charger behind, and they allowed me to borrow one they had at the desk through the end of my stay. Deltas: -Parking is $36 a night (ouch) -There are typos EVERYWHERE. I am a marketing person, so I interpret that typos equal lack of attention to detail. The room service menu is full of them. I cannot recall where else I saw them, but I recall that it seemed to be a weak point. -There are not ipod docks in the rooms (which I'm finding is pretty standard these days) -Room cleanliness wasn't A+. There was dirt and dried blood on the wall in my bathroom (gross.) -Rooms are semi-stylish (Versus entirely luxurious and stylish. It's more of a half-effort. Think of an upgraded Holiday Inn Express with a large ornate mirror.) -Room service was just okay. I ordered a diet coke, and it came flat, in a glass with plastic wrap over it. Maybe I'm used to hotels bringing the small bottles with ice in a glass? They should consider this. -My TV's connection was unstable and the screen kept freezing, so I just turned it off. It wasn't worth the hassle of them fixing it. -Super noisy. I was here at the start of Memorial Day Weekend, but I'm guessing that with the busy Gaslamp Quarter, it's like this every weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms, but extortionate parking charges and slow service”
Reviews.Author: UKScientist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in June 2011. On arrival, we were shocked by the price the hotel was charging for parking ($36 per night), although we found parking garages a few blocks away which charge $10 per night (or $15 per night at weekends). Our room was good and was functional, although it was lacking tea/ coffee making facilities. The bathroom was a triumph of style over function, with the raised sink being inconvenient and the sliding door not giving much privacy. We tried to get a drink in the pool-side bar, but we had to wait so long for service that we gave up. We also had to wait an age in the downstairs bar and to check out. I am not convinced there were enough staff on duty for a hotel of its size. The rooms and facilities are generally good, but the services and extra charges are not.

Reviews.Title: “Great room-nice staff-odd mix of other guests--”
Reviews.Author: WhyteWind
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our anniversary and had the Masters suite which was great! Our patio was next to the rooftop bar but we were never bothered by noise and it was a great place to sit at late at night and also with morning coffee. Our room was very comfortable and a very nice upscale property. We think the hotel wants to be a trendy cool place, but the guest mix ran the gamut from inappropriately dressed 20 somethings (read: sloppy & bathing suits in lobby) to bemused looking heartlanders to retirees. Not that hip!

Reviews.Title: “Save your money”
Reviews.Author: devo262
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a 4 night stay. Upon arriving a 3pm check-in time we were told that are room was not ready and they would gladly call us when it was. We had been traveling since 4am that morninbg so just wanted to take a shower and grab a bite so we had to wait, and wait and wait. The front desk person took our info and gladly swiped my CC to make sure they could open a credit line for internet,pool bar and honor fridge. @ 430 I again asked if room was ready and was told "Oh yeah no problem" We then proceeded to our room to find maid just finishing. Pushed out maid and hoped in shower to get a knock on door that they had forgot ot inventory mini fridge. Headed out for dinner all is forgivin at this point. Return to room after dinner @ 9-10pm to find that the beautiful pool area outside the window turn into a lound drunk fest. try to get past that and get a good nights sleep only to listen to room next door's conversation and love making session. Get to sleep to be woken @ 5am by barking dog down the hall because we all know you could never leave your poor lonely dog @ home! If the hotel is going to cater to pets then restrict them to 1 floor and prewarn any non-dog people. To recap drink @pool $12, Credit card was charged additional $2000 and hung up on by front desk when called to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 52BoiseTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as an alternative to the conference hotel in the Gaslamp Quarter. It is unique, customer service great, nice bar and pool area. We will stay here again when in San Diego. Loved it. One minor problem with housekeeping (don't forget to tip) but desk help and other days were great. Parking is high priced so avoid a car if you are just going to be at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and perks”
Reviews.Author: nuggets00
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Salomar and I loved it. They have a great pool deck and bar and the design of the hotel is great. Kimpton has some great perks such as a $10 mini bar credit, free coffee in the morning, a free wine hour in the evening, and free wireless for members. If you are traveling with a pet it seems that they do quite a bit to cater to them. Located in the Gaslamp district. The good: hotel looks fairly new and is in good shape, pool deck area is very nice and includes a bar that also serves food, bathroom was nicely designed, bed was comfortable, and the perks that I noted above. Best of all is the staff - extremely friendly, helpful, and nice. The OK: I had a deluxe room and I thought that it was pretty small compared to other hotels, took a long time for housekeeping to service my room (by 4PM I contacted the front desk to get housekeeping to clean the room). The bad: nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ndfan01
Reviews.Content: My brother treated his wife and I to a weekend getaway at the Hotel Solamar for our birthdays. Although he'd hoped to secure premium rooms, the hotel was at capacity and we received two standard rooms across the hall from each other on the top floor. The property: This is a new looking and feeling hotel, in a great location for access to Petco Stadium and the good restaurants in the Gaslamp Quarter. The lobby is very nice with fireplaces, comfortable seating and a quiet relaxing vibe. The best feature is the pool deck with its cabanas, bar and seating area. Although the pool is not large and there aren't as many loungers as might be needed for a lot of guests to sun and swim, it is lovely place to spend the day, with a nice selection of food and drinks available and pretty good service most of the time. The standard room: I had a king room facing the pool deck on the top floor. It was a nice enough view of the pool and Petco, as well as the streets of the Gaslamp district. Being able to open the window for some fresh air was a nice little feature, although on Saturday evening, the bar was lively enough that I had to shut the window for some shuteye. With the window closed though, I wasn't bothered by any noise. The bathroom is small with combo tub/show, but pretty and with the necessary conveniences along with nice towels, good shampoos and bath gel and the (best blow dryer ever...) The lighting could be a little better for ladies putting on makeup but other than that, it was fine. The bed was fantastic--The mattress must have been new, but the linens were also perfect. Nice big flat screen TV with many channel choices, but some reception problems from time to time. Closet not huge, but good enough for a few people staying a few nights, and there was also a safe placed in some open shelves in the closet area. Very nice easy chair, and small but serviceable desk with plenty of easy access plugs. Free wireless for joining the Kimpton club (also free.) A cute animal print robe rounds out the room amenities. Look around too for coupons and deals on the bulletin board in the room. We got a discount on breakfast at the hotel restaurant, and my brother had a coupon for a mini bar discount. Everything was clean, good condition and new looking. Housekeeping was terrific. Service was quite pleasant across the board. Everyone was friendly from valet, to front desk, housing and maintenance, hotel bar personnel and cafe staff. I enjoyed the free coffee and newspapers in the AM although we missed the wine social in the afternoon both days. This is a great hotel for business travelers, those who just want some quiet leisure time or someone who wants to explore the city and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in desirable Gaslamp with sweet military discount!”
Reviews.Author: blujewel03
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! The location is great, just two blocks from the convention center and a half block from 6th Street nightlife bars and great restaurants. The boutique style of the hotel makes it hard to stay in regular hotels. Nicely decorated rooms, the haidryers in the bathroom are real hairdryers, not the wallmounted sort that rarely work. Great mini bar with snacks in addition the drinks. On our second stay here, we were given a 10$ gift certificate to "raid the minibar," a nice touch. The pool area is super, making me want to stay there instead of wander the town. With attentive waitresses and plenty of pavillions and shade. The pool itself isn't huge, but it's the right size to dip into and cool off. With Government (military) and AAA discounts, we paid only $130+ tax. I had special requests - away from elevator and firm pillows- and they actually listened to the request. I think we will probably always stay here when we come to SD.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONAL: from sassy bulldogs to chamomile apple juice iced tea”
Reviews.Author: blissfork
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Plain and simple. My boyfriend and I are beach people, but as a cost-saving measure we decided to book the first night of our three night stay in San Diego at a downtown hotel (Solamar). It was love at first sight, and that was just the beginning. The staff are exceptional - friendly, welcoming, and accommodating. I was greeted with a smile whenever and wherever I ran across an employee. The little extras? 1. Unlimited ice cold chamomile apple juice iced tea at check-in. AMAZING. Having a little sip of magnificence after a rough flight was just what I needed. 2. A hosted happy hour with a red wine, white wine, AND sangria. My group of three all selected the Voigner before seeing the sangria option. We were totally bummed, assuming we had missed our one shot at a beverage that looked earth-shatteringly incredible. NOPE! Before we finished plotting a way to beg the "bartender" for a small sip of the sangria, he offered to top us all off. And by top us all off, I mean completely refill our empty glasses. We told him we would love to try the sangria instead, and he poured us three heaping glasses of the magical elixir. It was a pink sangria made with watermelon and strawberry puree, Grand Marnier, Triple Sec, and a few other odds and ends. I have never tasted anything that good in my life. 3. A pool and lounge area that is lively during the afternoon and evening, but dead quiet in the early morning as the sun begins to shine down upon it. It's a perfect place for a morning tea and a book read. 4. A leopard robe in the room (wish there had been two of them though...) The rooms are hip, modern, spacious, and fun to spend time in. They do not smell like hotel (you know what I mean), and they actually made me forget about the beach for a while, which is a near impossible feat. My one complaint (and it's a tiny one) is that the walls are a bit thin. I could hear the people next door singing Marine songs to their kid (a new recruit?) until the wee hours. The windows are solid though -- When shut you can't hear any of the pool noise below (at least not from the 9th floor). All in all, a solid 5 stars, a GREAT deal for the money, and you can't beat the downtown location -- just steps from the Padres field and The Mission (one of the best breakfasts in town). I just wish I knew where they sourced the mirrors in their rooms from. They're to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: SpeedwayCJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Solamar for a quick overnight in San Diego while attending an event. Had stayed with Kimpton Hotels once prior (Boston) and loved it, so I trusted the brand and that helped make my final hotel decision this time. Got a killer AAA rate on a corner spa room, which was huge and luxurious. My room looked out (through 4 windows!) at Petco Park. Would be an amazing place for baseball fans. Minibar credit for Kimpton In Touch members was a nice touch (first time I've ever had something from a minibar!). Bathroom had a spacious shower with liquid soap, shampoo, conditioner dispensers. Also had a huge, deep spa tub (didn't try this out). Really, just an amazing amount of space in the bedroom/bathroom. Checkin staff was very friendly and helpful. Parking staff were absolutely amazing. Room service staff was terrific and food was delicious! Only drawback, the street in front of the hotel can become extremely busy if there's a game at Petco Park, but the parking staff made it quite easy to handle the crowd and got me in and out of the hotel easily. Overall, an amazing stay. Can't wait to come up with an excuse to spend a couple nights in San Diego, so I can stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: bom2535
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Kimpton Hotels before and this one sure no slightest disappointment. Great location, super staff making our big group check-in in a swift. Friendly front desk staff were really helpful in many occasions. Wine tasting at around 5 pm made our daily warm up great.
