Reviews.Content: The pool, which gets all the hype, is neat. Very lounge like with big screen TV's and nice ambience....but the rest of the hotel needs a serious upgrade in management. I honestly can't say I have ever seen dirty carpet to this extreme in any hotel. Large dust bunnies in the recessed areas at the entrance of most doorways, less than average in room cleanliness, and a very odd smell..particularly in some hallways. Maybe this is due to a pet friendly policy, but it smelled more like must/mold than pet chemicals. I will say that one housekeeping staff was very good, and one of the girls at the front desk was very friendly and nice with directions, however another acted as if the last place she wanted to be was working at the front desk of a hotel. We also had a door key issue when we checked in late one night that ended up with maintenance working on our door at 11pm at night. Sorry neighbors! This was after 2 keys would not work upon check-in. We asked for another (equal) room instead the might be quieter anyway, since we had prerequested a quiet room and ours was right outside the pool area where the action can get loud at night, but they were bound and determined to fix the door and wanted to move us the next day instead. This allowed us two different floors, one MUCH cleaner than the other, but I can not in good conscience recommend this hotel for anyone but those under 25 that are there to party and crash. The drunken, falling guys in the lobby area one night make this apparent as well as the lack of seriousness in upkeep of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME LOCATION, INCREDIBLE HOTEL - LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: AM143
Reviews.Content: After lots of research, we stayed at Hotel Solamar and loved it. The hotel is in the heart of the Gaslamp Quarter and within walking distance to all the restaurants, Petco Stadium, the convention center, etc. It is very elegant and contemporary. The rooms were very roomy and well equipped. It was very child friendly. The staff was extremely pleasant. The complimentary breakfast was a little small, but we still enjoyed it. The hotel has an awesome bar and pool on the 3rd or 4th floor with a great view. The biggest downfall is the $32 a night valet parking but there is a lot 2 blocks away for $8 a night if you don't mind the walk. We are looking forward to returning sometime soon. San Diego is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is near perfect”
Reviews.Author: TravellingScotThommo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 8 days at the end of September and it's difficult to find fault with this hotel so we can't wait to go back and stay there again. It's clean, the staff are friendly and informative - knowing just the restaurant for whatever you fancied to eat, it's perfectly located for walking to the numerous attrations and the tram system. The only thing we found a bit strange was our room had no wardrobe or any hanging space, maybe this isn't typical but it meant we had clothes lying all over the room. We had a lovely view over the pool area and the noise wasn't a problem because we were on the top floor but I imagine it could get noisy if you were on the lower floors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for walking in and around San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Peterjules
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading reviews on Tripadvisor. And we are glad we did. The hotel was ideally located as my husband was attending a convention at the Convention centre. It was only about a 5 minute walk to here. The Gaslamp restaurant precinct was only 2 minutes away and the most recommended restaurants were only a short walk from the hotel. The concierge had a very handy map with all the restaurants written on it and was more than happy to help us with recommendations. Shopping was very easily accessible as well due to small boutique shops in the next street along with Westfield Horton Plaza only 10 minutes walk away. We did not eat in the restaurant here as we had been told by a fellow traveller that breakfast was very busy and not very good. However, two shops away is the Broken Yolk which has a great menu and very inexpensive breakfasts for most the day. The pool area on the 4th floor has a bar, and a great atmosphere. We even witnessed a wedding as well as a film festival function on one day! We stayed in the Masters Suite and found it to be very comfortable. One criticism was the lack of information in the room. There were no books explaining the hotels amenities or services. The laundry bag was hanging in the wardrobe but there were no instructions regarding the service. However, this was a small shortcoming for the excellent facilities and location. A very mixed group of people staying here, however, I did take heed when reading the reviews and requested a high up quiet room as the pool bar can get noisy at night. Don't forget the free wine hour every day. Its great for networking or just making friends.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be bettered”
Reviews.Author: Bhoys0
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Solemar 30 August for 5 nights. This was our first visit to San Diego and cannot wait to return to this hotel. The hotel is faultless. It is spotlessly clean, the staff in all areas are exceptional, the rooms were beautiful, the beds are very comfortable and we had plenty of storage space for hanging clothes etc. The restaurant staff are very knowledgeable and welcoming and the staff at reception cannot do enough to help. My husband had left his prescription spectacles in a shop at Las Vegas Airport and the receptionists assisted us in locating them and helped us to track the delivery by FedEx - nothing is too much trouble for these guys. Although we did not eat in JSix in the evening, if the breakfasts are anything to go by I am sure it would have been delightful. The breakfasts are fantastic and we had a good deal with comp breakfast and anything else off the menu for $5. What a deal! As before, the wine reception is a great idea - I would have preferred 6 until 7 but I shouldn't complain. We spent several happy hours in the pool area of an evening and it is a great place to hang out. I can 100% recommend this hotel and have advised my travel provider to recommend this hotel to her future clients. Solemar is ideally situated for all that is going on in San Diego with its fantastic restaurants, bars etc all to hand. All being well we hope to return to Hotel Solemar in a year's time and this time we will make our stay much longer.

Reviews.Title: “Dog friendly, modern, central downtown location”
Reviews.Author: MattAndEmilysTravels
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the quality of this hotel, from reception to to the bedroom all decor was high quality, well kept and done in a playful modern beach style. Cleanliness was impeccable, up with a 5 star hotel. Expect to pay many tips in a hotel with constant service, and don't be surprised at the price of parking, $35. I did the math and it would have been cheaper to park as a "non guest", what a joke! Coffee is only available in the lobby during certain hours, a negative in my opinion. Bed was nicely dressed with down comforter and great sheets, but the mattress was not up to par. How long has in been since they've made mattresses that bounce one side when the other moves? Every time my husband was up or down, I was flopped around. Perhaps Kimpton could order some Heavenly beds? Our room was a corner with three bright window that were able to open, a big plus in my book. There was plenty of room and even a nice closet with shelves and safe (and no mirrored door!). Bathroom was well appointed with Aveda bath products, average size tub and nice shower head. Bathroom had modern vessel sink and beautiful tile. The only down side was the lack of lighting near the bathtub/shower. Only lighting was around sink and a half wall blocked most of that light from getting to tub. No a big deal, but don't expect to do any precision shaving. They also host an afternoon wine reception, if you're into that. I'd pass the alcohol for better parking rates. We found it odd that a pet friendly hotel had no real green space for them to take care of "business" or play. They offered a tiny strip in the sidewalk that has obviously been overused bey their customers (and not even their property, city property). Petco park has a dog friendly area, but for quick morning and bedtime trips this hotel needs to find a better solution. The receptionist was also happy to allow us an early check-in(really early, 9 am), after an all night drive. Internet is free if you are a member of their Kimpton brand "club", you are able to sign up on the spot very easily. Otherwise $10/day. Pool and sun deck area on fourth floor looked really nice, although we did not have the opportunity to enjoy ourselves. We did see (from our room), movies playing one night against one wall, which looked fun. They also had several intimate fire pits and bar area. Great location if downtown is you destination. Petco park is about a half block away, lots of restaurants, close to shopping, though it's all chain/mall stores, so don't expect anything original. If you are going to the convention center, it's about a 5-10 minute walk. Great for business. If you're looking for family/beaches you better off in the mission bay area or be prepared to hop in the car. It's easy to get to the freeway and just a 10 minute drive, but if Seaworld, and beaches are your destinations, you cannot walk there.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: armstrongs4us
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel through Hotwire for 79.00 a night. My husband is in the military and had just come back from Iraq. While he was gone, Our 20th Anniversary and both our birthdays had passed. So we thought it would be nice to celebrate everything the day of his return. The staff at check in was simply amazing, providing details about the hotel and where to go. The room was immaculate and I am VERY picky when it comes to the cleanliness of hotel rooms. Within a couple hours of our checking in, we received a knock at our door to find a gentleman holding wine and chocolate covered strawberries and telling us they were "on the house" and welcomed my husband home and thanked him for his service!!!! We were simply astonished at such service. We will definitely return to this hotel, the service is wonderful, the rooms are extremely comfortable. We stayed on a friday night on the "pool side" and did not find it loud at all like some of the other reviews. We could hardly hear anything.....very quiet and relaxing. Thank you to Hotel Solomar to make our homecoming so special.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Lovely”
Reviews.Author: newlyweds01
Reviews.Content: After a disappointing stay at the La Costa resort, we didn't have high hopes for this hotel as I think it is ranked as a 3* whereas La Costa was 5*, however, it did NOT disappoint! The staff were friendly and helpful without seeming fake or pretentious and the afternoon wine hour was a lovely little extra! They made sure we were made aware of this upon check-in as well! Our room was beautiful - very clean and nicely freshened everyday; they even offer the use of things you may have forgotten during your stay such as hair straighteners etc! We ate at the restaurant once during our stay and the food was delicious and, again, staff were a pleasure to deal with. We could not have asked for a nicer hotel for such a reasonable price! The hotel is also in a great location and the front desk staff are very helpful if you need advice about transportation etc - they offered to call us cabs and make dinner reservations for us etc. An absolutely delightful end to our honeymoon and we would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire for $97”
Reviews.Author: PHXGAL
Reviews.Content: I'm reviweing based on the above rate we got through hotwire, not off the $200 rack rate. Pros -Value -Great Location - Beautiful hotel with helpful staff -5pm free wine hour every night Cons -No where to store clothes in room, i.e. chest of drawers -Parking Parking was my biggest concern. We used meters which are free on Sunday and 6pm-8am. So we arrived Sat and paid for a few hours. Then the car sat free until Monday. We fed the meters herre and there throught the weekdays but we were also using the car. It worked out awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a few quirks....”
Reviews.Author: PicoAcores
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel is very nice. The location couldn't be any better....right in the heart of Gaslamp. Very clean hotel with quiet rooms (if you ask to be on the opposite side of the pool). Quirks? Well, parking is $35 a night. There are no other options since parking across the street was $15-$20 with no "in and out" priviledges and not as secure. The pool is very small. We never used it. We felt a little out of place there since it was mostly a "pick-up area" for the singles. The gym? Well, it has 3 machines and some weights. Other than that, it was really a great place. The staff is very nice....especially in the valet area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel, Spotty Service, Ridiculously Overpriced Parking”
Reviews.Author: sbjjill
Reviews.Content: Other reviews tout the amenities and overall cleanliness, comfort, trendiness and relative quiet as well as great location of the Hotel Solamar. Hereâ€™s some wrinkles during a two-night stay in mid-August: .The so-called free internet service available to Kimpton In Touch guests never worked for us but we didn't pursue it after two inquiries with the front desk. .We stayed only two nights and on the second day, our room was still not "made up" at 2 pm which I thought was rather late so I had to call the front desk. In the hallway, housekeeping staff seemed to imply to me that their workload had recently increased. (Sounds like a cost-cutting move on the part of management.) Guests shouldnâ€™t have to wait until mid-afternoon when they return to the room to work or relax/nap to have housekeeping come in while using the room. .Parking is advertised on the website as $32 but is posted at the hotel entry as $35. (Either way, itâ€™s ridiculously overpriced!) The front desk claimed the rate changed either 2 or 3 months ago and that it has been updated on the website but remembering that I read it there only a month ago or less, I asked them to honor the prior advertised price. (Because the internet service didnâ€™t work for us, I couldnâ€™t check it during our trip). I had no less than four conversations with different front desk staff the first night and next morning before ascertaining that the parking staff (apparently, a separately-run business) approved the discount. Talking to so many different people was a major irritant -- couldn't the first person get the answer immediately? Now that weâ€™re home, I see that the website price is still $32 (on 8/20) â€“ despite their claims that the increased price had been posted â€“ but if Kimpton reads these reviews, it will get changed soon! .The bathroom is wonderful except the sink â€“ a trendy design that causes water to splash everywhere because itâ€™s set so high. .The rooftop pool is small (and pretty chilly) with limited seating but we got lucky on a weekday and had a cabana to ourselves. In three hours time, staff never once walked around to pick up towels left behind on chaises that guests had left unoccupied for hours, which means late-comers think all lounges are taken. Staff should make sure guests aren't reserving chairs for long blocks of time. .When we checked out and were asked about our stay, I said â€œthere were a few wrinklesâ€� but she never asked what they were or if I was ultimately satisfied with my stay. We would recommend this hotel but think management has some work to do.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: grneyes1
Reviews.Content: We went this July for a bachelorette party. I reserved the room months in advace and they still messed up on our attached room to the connecting suite we had to call down all morning to ask when it would be ready they had to put us in another room down the hall since they rented our room out by mistake, then they kicked us out of our cabana that we were in first. They told us it was already reserved but we asked and they said it was first come first serve. They did send over a round of drinks for the inconvience but still it was really rude and embarresing for us to gather up our belongings and have to move. The only nice person in this hotel was Rauly Romero he took good care of our large party. Tell me why they put us next to a family when i specificly told them its a bachelorette party, expect us to be a little loud. They called us numerous times to quite down. We had a great time in San Diego but a bad experience with this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “welcoming hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: cashbox1124
Reviews.Content: Although we booked this hotel through an amazing travelzoo promotion (a great hotel rate and a bottle of wine), when I checked in, we were treated as if we were paying full-price (which is very steep). The hotel is in a perfectly central location within the Gaslamp Quarter of San Diego - walking distance to TONS of bars, clubs, restaurants and shops, along with Petco Park. The pool area is beautiful and very posh with cabanas, a bar and flat screens, all overlooking the San Deigo skyline. A great place for a staycation with your loved one or family!

Reviews.Title: “A Must Go Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daOScotland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adjacent to everything you would want to see in San Diego and particularly to the gaslamp district for eating. The entrance is superb and the decor throughout the hotel is modern and striking. Our room was fantastic; there is a good pool area although better for drinking than lying out in the sun and the use of loud cellphones was a bind; it should be restricted. Reception was the least of it; the bellboy was distinctly surprised that we wanted him to take cases to our room and the reception staff rarely look up to greet you as you pass. Others in the hotel were a credit. Every afternoon there is a free drinks party; good company and good wine.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming hotel with sleek decor.”
Reviews.Author: rupeeler
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed ar the Hotel Solamar for three nights in July, 09'. Reception was wonderful, friendly and efficient. We were warmly welcomed and given a room change, simply because I asked that our room have "a view." I was pleasantly surprised to see that our view was one of the best the hotel can offer. Our room was very clean and modern and made us feel right at home. The space was small and didn't offer a lot of storage, but everything else more than made up for it. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom lighting offered a dim setting so that you could have a night light for finding your way in the middle of the night. Most of the time, I find I must leave a light on at night, but close the door but for a crack. I was so impressed with this feature being well considered in the room design. The bathroom was beautiful! While our stay was wonderful, I do have a couple of issues. First, the room did not have a personal coffee maker. No offense with the hotel's desire to have guest mingle by serving morning coffee in the living room. Unfortunately, some of us, myself included, are simply not that alert and prepared to make the journey for coffee. I would still prefer a couple of cups of joe at my finger tips, without having to order room service...which was exactly what I did. My second issue is the parking fee of $35/night. Flat out, that is the most I have ever paid for overnight parking on any trip that required I rent a car. This quickly eroded some of the "value" I felt I was given in the nightly room rate. Bottom line, I will return to the Hotel Solamar!

Reviews.Title: “Posh hotel, expensive parking!”
Reviews.Author: robk2468
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice with chic style decoration. Only has Valet parking which is very expensive ($32 a night!). Location is good right in the middle of San Diego. Only problem was the pool partys music (nightclub style) was very noisy the first night we stayed, luckily we were very tired so could sleep through it. Free wine hour and coffee in the morning is also a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Central for Gaslamp area and Petco Park”
Reviews.Author: babybuny
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms which were well decorated and modern. We had room on top floor overlooking the baseball stadium which was interesting. The hotel is in very busy location so if you don't want to be disturbed ask for this type of room away from pool area which turns into a bar and nightclub at night. Can't comment on food as we ate out all the time though coffee and wine in the lounge was nice and we took them back to our room. Parking is expensive but that goes for all hotels in the City and they were very quick getting the car. The lady on the desk was very helpful advising us to get a taxi to the zoo which was cheaper than parking there. Don't think we will return to San Diego but the hotel was very good and we got a good rate from netflights.com

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel perfect location”
Reviews.Author: plrloves2travel
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the internet, was planning a trip to San Diego for awhile, but waited to book. Looked at the Hard Rock, Ivy, W, and Omni as well. Was very pleased I picked this hotel when I got there. We did not rent a car and really didn't need one for the 4 days we were there. The hotel is a short walk to the Ferry to Coronado where we spent a leisurely Sunday on the beach at the Hotel Del Coronado. Also took a bus to La Jolla which the staff at the hotel gave us instructions on where to get it, very easy. The hotel is very modern and clean. The staff is very accomodating and the pool is great for relaxing. The weekends get a good crowd at the pool and pool bar. Brian the bartender is very nice. There is not a lot of reserving chairs that goes on which is nice, you can just take one as they open up. Wine hour is a great plus, everyone comes out for it and the coffee is the morning from 6-10 is very convenient. Petco stadium is a short walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Location.... and all on a budget. FABULOUS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: JaxNewZealand
Reviews.Content: I booked our 8 night stay at the Solamar in a bit of a hurry and admit to being a little nervous prior to check in. The price for the central gaslamp district location looked too good to be true. I was expecting to be disappointed and for this to be one of those times when the photos looked better than the reality. I had looked at other quality hotels in the area and they were much more expensive, so wasnt expecting much. However, on arrival we checked in to a very classy and upmarket reception area and was greeted with complimentary wines and nibbles (offered to guests daily in the afternoons) and then we were delighted with the appointment of our room. Large king size bed and roomy room with a fridge. Very modern fittings and decor. We got a rollaway bed for our son and there was plenty of room for it. They didnt charge extra for it (most other hotels seem to charge a nightly fee for these). The bathroom was luxourious but did not have a full bath (it was 3/4 size). The air conditioning was very good and quiet. Large flat screen TV and good selection of channels. We were on the top floor and overlooked Pitco Park. There were baseball games and fireworks most night (very cool!)... but dispite this the room was very quiet (double glazing) and it didnt impact our stay in a negative way. In fact it was fun to watch. Great black out curtains helped get our son to sleep and sleep in in the mornings. The hotel offered a complimentary continential breakfast and although it wasnt quite what we were expecting it was a lovely start to the day. It comprised of a pastry, and lovely bowl of fresh fruit and coffee/tea. You could add other items from the menu for a cost. We enjoyed the rooftop pool although it is quite small and very popular in the afternoons. The staff were very helpful and freindly. The only real negative for me was that there were no guest laundry services (other than drycleaning for individual items). There were also no coin laundries nearby. The staff did not have a solution/suggestion when I enquired and I would have thought they would have been asked for directions etc before but I definatley felt like I was the first ever person to ask this question. I had to travel a long way by public transport to a pretty scarey district out of town to do this. The outside is an old brick building that looks like it could have been a firestation or something like that....it is extremely understated. Once you go inside you will be pleasantly surprised. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who needs a good location near to public transport, shops, many many great resturants, the waterfront etc - but that is also on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Jodie085
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel (especially considering the great deal I found). The decor throughout was trendy yet classy. I didn't have much contact with the hotel staff other than the basic checking in and out but from that bit I was pleased. Each staff member was welcoming, friendly, and personable. Even the cleaning ladies in the hallways were very joyful. We arrived at the hotel around 10AM and were able to get right in our room which was a nice surprise. Our room was tidy, clean and very comfortable. Our view was overlooking the pool deck/bar which seemed to stay pretty busy all day. There was a yoga class held there in the morning that people seemed to enjoy and plenty of sun and beverages for the remainder of the day. The hotel location was perfect for our needs. Within a short walking distance to the baseball park, convention center and numerous restaurants and shopping areas. This made staying here extremely convenient and easy. I can't say I have many gripes about the hotel. The elevators were sometimes slow and the hot water in my shower could have been a bit hotter, but it was not uncomfortable. As I said, the pool stayed pretty busy and I found it difficult to find an empty lounge chair on the weekends, so if you are looking to get a tan at your hotel pool, get there early to claim your spot. Overall, I was very pleased with this hotel and would definitely recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanFrancisoGirl
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay. Very clean and we had no complaints. The staff was so friendly and helpful and the rooms very nice. The pool area fun...during the day swimming, tanning with poolside drinks and eats...during the evening it becomes an attractive lounge which is also popular with the locals. We had read tips about possible noise, so requested a room away from the night life and never had a problem. This hotel is located in the Glass Lamp district with tons of great restaurants (really there are blocks with nothing but great restaurants right nex to each other) within just a block or two and a few blocks to the Horton Mall and Another Tours (a gun segway tour of the city). If you love seafood you cannot miss eating at the Oceanaire Restaurant at 4th and J Streets. I don't even like fish, but this was really something.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel With TERRIBLE SERVICE, NO Management Leadership”
Reviews.Author: International_Norcal
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a great location with great decor but it operates with ZERO emphasis on customer service. Visiting with family for anniversary gathering, our experience was ruined by a staff which failed to uphold and provide service consistent with Kimpton Hotel's Mission Statement and Values. The pool lounge ran by a Mr. Holland was very inconsistent in how they operate. The environment the Solamar staff creates is consistent with boarding school and not a hotel facility. With no leadership beginning with management, everybody just shifts blame with no accountability. Such a shame for such a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you have pets!”
Reviews.Author: melissablack
Reviews.Content: hi - just got back from staying there. Small rooms and they do have a frig in each room - BUT their stuff is in there so if you are like me and take your own dog food, waters, yogurt,etc... - just keep it all in your own ice chest. The parking is steep at 32 a night - BUT you are not charged anything for pets or high speed internet access. The BEST 60 restaurants are within walking distance and we got a good rate on hotels.com for 100 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Beachside Lodge in city location”
Reviews.Author: geoman75
Reviews.Content: The Solamar has a real beachside feel for a hotel located in the middle of the city. It is laid back and spaced out and really top notch. They put a lot of effort into the smaller things here to really lift your stay above the average. The wine and cheese tasting in the evening and free tea and coffee in the lobby each morning is a nice touch - even if you don't use it, still makes you feel as if the hotel is really trying to make a good impression. Free newspapers each morning. There is free wifi - though a somewhat ridiculous setup process involving joining the Kimpton Club, which is free. On the up side my iphone automatically logged itself into another Kimpton hotels wifi when we were in San Francisco. Our room had two separate areas with a living room / bedroom set up. Neither room was huge but both had enormous televisions. The two areas had a sliding door so you could lock yourself off if you really wanted to. All the photos on Trip Advisor show a walk in shower in the rooms. Our room didn't have one. So if this is important to you I would make sure you request one when you book. There are nice touches in the room that make it seem like a more personal hotel rather than another big chain. From the distinctive bathrobes, to the pinboard where they place notes about what's going on in the hotel and around town. The pool and bar area on the rooftop is lovely during the evening sun. Though one night they closed half of it off for a private function. The only thing I'd really complain about is the valet parking. The hotel seems to have the most expensive parking in the city. It is $32. Directly across the road from the hotel entrance is self park lot that charges $15. It's a great location with plenty of good restaurants, shopping and sites around the Gaslamp Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Mclevans
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about this hotel, we recently stayed four nights and found everything to be wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Like the W without the attitude...”
Reviews.Author: IDONTTRAVELENUF
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a business trip for myself and my boss; we stayed just one night in San Diego, but he & I both love this type of modern hotel. It did not disappoint! Fast easy check-in, super fast valet parking ($32/nt.), great rooms with gorgeous decor and super comfortable beds. Free wireless internet! Really cool bathrooms with Aveda products. First rate all the way. I booked on Kimpton.com and it was $119 a night + $1 for continental breakfast (you can "upgrade" to eggs for $7). I will definitely stay here next time I'm in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Futureworldtravelers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Solamar for about four nights. We enjoyed our stay and would return to the hotel. The room was a decent size with decent closet space and nice decor the chaise was a plus. The hotel offered a complimentary tea hour in the morning and wine hour in the evening. The rooftop pool area/lounge was spacious and had heat lamps. The negative part is that parking at the hotel was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Way cool with great location and special amenities”
Reviews.Author: CrosbyArch
Reviews.Content: Visited June 9 with family (two adults and kids 9 and 7). Took advantage of a special rate that included a bottle of wine and breakfast as well. Hotel is a nice one - boutique feel to it. Not large in terms of lobby and meeting areas nor rooms but very comfortable. Highlights include a rooftop pool on 4th floor, 'wine hour', a very nice workout room (Precor etc), comforting polished staff. Location is awesome - gaslamp district, near Petco baseball stadium.. Drug store one block away -- what more can you ask for?? It's geared for both business and leisure -- I hope they can keep it affordable for leisure travelers as it's a treat to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Solamar”
Reviews.Author: motorcityc
Reviews.Content: We were able to check in a bit early for our stay with no problems. The front desk staff and concierge were always extremely nice and very helpful. Our room was clean and well-stocked. The location can't be beat - right in the Gaslamp District, easy walking distance to tons of restaurants, shops, bars and the trolley. The evening wine reception was a nice plus and the dinner we had at the restaurant was top notch to me! The hotel is cool, funky, wonderfully decorated and in nice shape. With the furnishings and music, etc., they definitely cater to a younger crowd. I just wish the weather was better so we could have enjoyed the rooftop pool and lounge. The hotel was not super crowded while we were there so we didn't notice any noise from the bar area, but I can see how it night be bothersome if you were in a room that faced it on a busy night. I really have nothing but nice things to say about our visit. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, loved it. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, yet comfortable boutique hotel - PERFECT location.”
Reviews.Author: macabee98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to San Diego to meet some friends who live there and to participate in the 2009 Mud Run at Camp Pendleton. I saw all the great reviews of Hotel Solamar on TripAdvisor, so I checked into room rates on various websites, including the hotel's website. The hotel's website had the most expensive room rate and 1800hotels.com had by far the BEST and least expensive rate. I called the hotel's reservation line and they matched the rate that 1800hotels.com was offering. That saved us over $50/night. We checked right in upon arrival and the front desk staff and valet attendants were very friendly. Our room was on the 7th floor overlooking 6th street. The room was beautifully decorated with modern decor, huge flat screen TV, very comfortable bed with no top comforter - which we LOVED - just triple sheeting and throw pillows that matched the decor of the room. The bathroom was clean, very nice modern fixtures, Aveda amenities and white fluffy towels. The shower head was fabulous - almost like a steam shower with great water pressure. They have FREE in-room Wi-fi! That's a big plus! They have a wine reception every evening from 5 - 6pm offering a red, white and sangria. We went both nights and enjoyed our wine and good conversation in the 'living room'. Also, each morning they offer a coffee and tea reception until 9:30am. We didn't eat at the hotel's restaurant, but the pizza samples that we tried during the wine reception were very tasty. We also didn't use the pool, but we did have drinks out by the back area of the pool that overlooked the street. The location of the hotel is absolutely perfect. We were close enough to walk to PETCO Park to see a baseball game (just around the corner). There are so many great restaurants, bars and shops within walking district of the hotel. Friday night we enjoyed a meal at Old Spaghetti Factory to carbo load before the 10K race the next morning. Then on Saturday night, we had dinner at one of our favorite restaurants, Sevilla. You can't beat the Sangria and tapas! On Sunday morning, we walked to Mary Jane's Coffee Shop, which is located next to the Hard Rock Hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will be going there again on our next trip to San Diego. The only downside is the $32/night valet fee. Being from Vegas, I'm used to free valet parking. There is a $20/day parking lot across the street, but for safety reasons we opted to pay the $32/night fee. So, with the $50/night we 'saved' by getting the 1800hotels.com rate, we ended up using it for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Your service is slipping.....”
Reviews.Author: cabogolf19
Reviews.Content: As a regular guest at the Solamar I am sad to say, that guest service seems to be slipping. I am a Kimpton In-Touch Program member and the hotel is well aware of my room preferences ( I stay here monthly). This trip, my status as an In-Touch member as wells as my room preferences were completely disregarded. I was also checked-in at the wrong room rate. I still think the hotel is lovely and will continue to stay here, but I will be more dilligent at check-in to make sure that I get the room and the rate that I asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Glad to give it a second chance, what a stay, will be back in july!”
Reviews.Author: Umailop
Reviews.Content: They say 3rd time's a charm, i dont think my 2nd stay this past weekend can be topped, but who knows! Very appreciative of the Manager Wendi, who was able to accomodate me for a consecutive night stay. Originally I was slated for a friday and sunday night since saturday was not available, but Wendi was able to work her magic and I had a friday-sunday stay. Arrived a tad before 1pm as I took the train and was pleasantly welcomed and allowed to check in early since the room had not been used the night before. The corner king spa room was lovely! Located on the 9th floor opposite the pool I had great views of Petco Park(not the actual field though, due to the fact there is a hotel tower obstructing the view). Received a complimetnary welcome gift in the afternoon, which is always appreciated. Attended the wine hour friday before heading off to Joltn Joes nearby for dinner, drinks and sporting events. Went out to a nightclub literally across the street so this place is convenient for those attending a night out at Stingaree. 2nd day spent time at the pool, checked out the jazz festival going on nearby and walked over to meet friends up at Hooters for dinner and the UFC fight. Of course I put the tub to use and relaxedin the jacuzzi. Sunday morning prior to leaving had another pleasant surprise, and if I could give this stay 6 stars, I would! I am a frequent visitor to san diego and will keep an eye out on special offers for the solamar since its is perfectly located to to an abundance of things in san diego. There was one complaint, and this had to do with the pool staff, which I am not sure if they are associated with the hotel or not. Saturday afternoon I went to go grab a sandwich at subway. On my way out the housekeeper on the floor(Very friendly btw) was cleaning the room next to mine so I asked if she could clean mine next since I was going to be going out to grab a bite. I wanted to allow her time to finish what she was doing, so I figured I could hang out at the pool area, watch the yankees game and have my sandwich while the room was getting cleaned. Unfortunately it turns out the pool also has a restaurant(all i had seen was a bar) and so she told me I could NOT bring outside food. Thats fine, BUT then on my walk out, i noticed A LOT of people with outside food. My room wasnt ready, so i ate in the living room area, headed back to the pool area to sit and watch the game and as i walked around most people lounging in the pool area had outside food. Perhaps the others choose not to follow the rules, but i never saw anyone else get spoken to like i did. Already recommended the hotel to a few friends and planning for a few of us to stay over the 4th of july weekend. Hope the stay is as wonderful as memorial day weekend stay was!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel of our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: JamesAllred
Reviews.Content: Travelled around California for two weeks and without doubt the best hotel we stayed in both in terms of service and quality. We were upgraded to the spa suite which was fantastic with great features and with a real eye for detail. We had one of our best meals of the trip at J6 where the service was great. We would have liked to have stayed longer but had unfortunately had to move onto LA where the Palomar wasn't quite so impressive! Thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Diego. James Allred

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shamean
Reviews.Content: Thankfully the Hotel Solamar was able to accommodate my early check-in (at 6:30am!), and upon entering the room, I noticed that these hotel rooms were unlike any other that I have seen. Very modern decor, complete with both zebra and leopard print robes, and spacious room. Because I was in town on business, I actually had to use the supplied desk for my laptop, but was also able to take advantage of the swivel function of the LCD-TV. As for the rest of the hotel, I was able to take part in their hosted wine tasting, and their outdoor pool and bar area. Additionally, the Hotel Solamar is VERY conveniently located in the heart of the Gaslamp district, and was accessible to every area of San Diego that I need to go to. My only suggestion to anyone staying here is to be advised that this hotel does cater to a younger, hip crowd, and that the pool and bar area can get noisy in the evening hours. If you prefer a quieter location, be sure to request a room far away from the pool. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in the heart of the Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: SunnySD1
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed here to celebrate our anniversary, we loved it! Great corner room with views of downtown! Loved the fuji tub!!! Comfortable, great service and very friendly staff! Would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT....LOVE IT...LOVE IT”
Reviews.Author: JgirlSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I live here in San Diego but find many recurring reason to be downtown in the gaslamp, the General Manager is outstanding, Rolly is suberb, and the front desk staff and the valet are amazing...I have been a recurring guest of this property over the past 3 years and just cant say enough about it...While I do belong to bigger hotel chains, the fact that they treat you as one of there family members always lures me back...I have already booked 4 other stays this year...I HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend it for your next visit to San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and Modern”
Reviews.Author: CMMNYC
Reviews.Content: Sleek modern hotel with lovely public spaces, nicely appointed rooms and a good location. Stayed for a weekend. Hotel has a very nice feel â€“ comfortable lounges, quick elevators, beautiful pool deck and helpful staff. Everything feels very new and well thought out. Located in the heart of the Gas Lamp District of San Diego, restaurant and shops were very accessible. Our standard room was fair sized â€“ chair with ottoman, comfortable bed, desk, not a lot of drawer space but closet had shelves/cubby holes. Room also had an iron and ironing board as well as a hair dryer. Bathroom was nicely appointed with large make-up mirror and Aveda products. (Hotel also provided, upon request essentials, that may have been forgotten â€“ toothpaste, feminine products, etc.) Room had a flat screen TV with cable as well as free wireless access. Didn't try any of the restaurants but had a drink at the Pool Bar Saturday evening. Was a nice crowd and a nice setting. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. Hotel is 100% non smoking but you could smoke in a designated area on the pool deck. Taxi from the airport was about $15, hotel offered parking (I believe at a cost), upon departure Bell Desk was very helpful in calling a taxi. Got a very good rate via Priceline ($99/nite.)

Reviews.Title: “Not your average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luscious_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel Solamar for 2 nights. The staff in the hotel that we encountered were all very helpful and friendly - in particular the staff on the front desk. Our bedroom was great; loved the dressing gowns! There is a wine hour in hotel from 5-6pm each evening; I thought this was a great idea; never saw this in any other hotel! The hotel was very trendy and quirky; with a personal touch that you don't find in the big hotel chains; also the location was great. The only complaint I would have is the valet parking rates, think it was around $30 a night, we noticed a place only about 2 blocks away for a third of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, great location.... expensive but maybe just about worth it”
Reviews.Author: IanW2007
Reviews.Content: A great location and a very stylish hotel. Brilliant staff and some lovely touches such as wine tasting each afternoon. They've totally missed a trick by serving passable Italian wines rather than great local wines though - of which there are many - but hey, a free glass of wine is not to be sniffed at. Would be even better if the rooftop pool was an actual pool, rather than just a plunge pool but the location of this hotel means you'll most likely hit the bars and restaurants of the Gas Lamp rather than loiter by the roof top bar anyway. Its location is a definite bonus, especially if you fancy taking in a baseball game as we did. Petco Park is pretty much next door.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at the Solamar”
Reviews.Author: cmna4
Reviews.Content: I just returned yesterday from a four day stay at the Solamar. I was on a mom/daughter mini vacation with my 28 year old daughter. I originally chose the Solamar for the great promo rate I heard about on the weekend edition of the Today Show. They showcased the hotel as a hip hotel and I thought it would appeal to my daughter. However, I was very skeptical after I booked it because of all the negative reviews I had read here at tripadvisor. I must say that our experience/stay was wonderful. Both of us were a little leary about staying in a hotel that allows pets because we both have allergies. I called the hotel and the front desk assured me they had a whole floor devoted to pet free rooms. (However, I could not find a place to indicate that I wanted a pet-free room when I reserved on-line. So if it is an issue for you, call them directly and request it. ) I had read many complaints about noise from the pool/bar area so upon check-in I asked for a room on the "quiet side." They did not have any rooms left on the quiet side of the pet-free floor, but would gladly move us to another floor that did have quiet side rooms available. The receptionist told us that the pet-free floor was the top floor of the hotel and that we would be far enough up from the pool/bar that noise should not be a problem. Obviously we could not stay in a pet friendly room and chose to stay with our original room, #1027, We could not have been happier. Our hotel room looked directly down on the pool/bar. We were able to watch the action without hearing any of the noise. For us, noise was not an issue at all. Previous reviews mentioned an unfriendly attitude among the staff. We did not find this to be the case. Everyone we encountered was helpful and friendly. Our room was very clean and up to date. Our housekeeper Maria was excellent. (We could tell she had the day off on Saturday. The room was clean, but not quite as well as when Maria made it up.) The front desk was very friendly and helpful at check-in. At night there is an evening wine reception in the "Living Room". They offered a white and a red Pinot on all four nights. It was not top drawer wine. But,judging by the crowd people did not seem to mind the quality of the free wine one bit. I thought the wine reception was a nice touch. I would like to suggest that they do not always serve the same exact wine every night. Maybe they could mix it up with a different red such as a Cab , Malbec, or possibly a Merlot and then a Charddonay for a white option. Something different for those of us who are staying more than one night. Still that is a minor complaint and free wine is better than no wine at all. We also received a bottle of wine at check-in that was part of our promo rate. Again, a nice touch. And we received coupons for free continental breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Someone mentioned in a review that they did not like that wait staff served you your continental breakfast because they felt obligated to leave a tip. We did not mind being served and leaving a tip. Juice or coffee, several choices of a pastry, and a beautiful fresh fruit bowl was the complimentary continental breakfast. I do not know if every guest automatically gets continental breakfast. But even with a tip, it was an inexpensive way to jumpstart the day. And if you are a big breakfast eater, you could always order something in addition to your fruit and pastry off their breakfast menu which we did one day. Of course, you have to pay for anything extra beyond the continental breakfast. I should mention that they also have free coffee and tea in the morning in the "Living Room". I am not a coffee drinker, but my daughter took advantage of this nice amenity. Some reviews mentioned that the pool was not clean. The weather was chilly when we were there, but people were using the pool. It looked very clean and we overheard a guest saying the water temperature was warm. We did not use the pool, but did enjoy relaxing by it one afternoon after a day of sightseeing. I am guessing the pool gets more use in the summer and more sunscreen residue probably builds up on the sides of the pool. If that were to happen, that would be a turn off for me as well. I loved the location of this hotel. It is close to public transportation and the PETCO stadium. We were able to walk from here to Little Italy with no problem. (On a hot day you would probably want to take the light rail public transportation known as the Trolley to Little Italy.) We also attended a baseball game at PETCO during our stay. It was nice not to have to hassle with finding a parking space near the stadium. Other reviews mentioned the cost of valet parking. We did not have a rental car so I cannot comment on this. A previous review said the fitness room was small. It is small, but I never had to wait for a treadmill. There are 2 treadmills, 1 eliptical, weights, and then a bike is actually outside adjacent to the fitness room. One morning one of the treadmills did not have any power, but a hotel employee promptly came in and fixed it. Finally, there are many restaurants and night clubs in the area. We ate at a couple of them. But our best meals were brunch at Hash House A Go Go in Hillcrest and dinner at the Top of the Fish Market. We took a taxi to Hash House A Go Go. It cost us $10.90 and I gave the driver $15. We took the Trolley to the Seaport Village stop and walked the rest of the way to the Fish Market on Saturday night. It was a lovely night and we ended up walking all the way back to the hotel after our dinner. I should mention that we did have a king room. I was prepared for a tiny room because of some of the other reviews. Maybe because I was on a cruise about four weeks ago, but I thought the room size was very adequate. The bathroom sink is annoying-very contemporary and shallow. I think you can see it on the hotel's website. Someone said it is too high. I would disagree with that. I am short and height isn't the issue. One, it is set too far back, but the real issue is that it is too shallow and water splashes every where. It does however look cool. For the promo rate and all the other pluses this hotel had to offer, the sink was tolerable for days. I know this review is long, but I hope it will help somebody who was on the fence about lodging. I am a very picky traveler who prefers 4 and 5 star hotels and who is obsessed with cleanliness. (The carpets in the hallways did look worn, but our carpet in the room was new.) Overall, my experience at the Solamar was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Noisy Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: vmagal1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Solamar was a really nice hotel. The rooms were very cute and contemporary. Its kind of dark when you first walk into the hotel itself after being outside in sunny California. I didn't have to interact with the staff often but checking in and out was quick and they were friendly. I was happy that they allowed us to check in early without any problem. Since I'm from Texas, its not the norm to have to pay to park, especially $32 per day. So that was pretty steep and not pleasant. The valet guys were polite and tried to be quick in getting the car. Although I'd have preferred skipping the whole valet thing because I'd have saved money in the constant tips and it would've been faster. But I suspect that this was how it is at all the hotels in San Diego so I couldn't be that disappointed in the parking situation. The beds were comfortable and they had nice flat screen TVs. The rooms were very nicely decorated and I was impressed. The only odd thing was that there weren't any drawers. The bathrooms were also nice. I just love the Aveda toiletries that they provide. One complaint that I do have is that there is a nightclub in the building and around 11pm the music can be heard in the room for a few hours. Luckily I was tired enough to sleep through it but it is very loud. Overall, I wasn't disappointed and I'd probably stay there again but I'd ask for a room as far away from that club as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel with fabulous restaurant”
Reviews.Author: mandy01Uk
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at a good rate through Net Flights after reading Tripadvisor reports. Arrived late Saturday night and friendly receptionist said we were allocated to a quiet room on the 4th floor however the next day because we were staying 5 nights they were upgrading us to the 10th floor corner room, which had three large windows, was a really large room and a view of the sea, Petco Park and the pool. Our rate included continental breakfast which was delicious - fresh orange juice, deliciously fresh and varied fruit bowl and freshly made breads and coffee. The breakfast was so good we also tried dinner and were not disappointed. Great value for the quality of food served. This restaurant deserves to be fully booked every night. Again because of the quality we used the restaurant several times during our stay. We were so impressed with our stay that we booked it again for our final 2 days before travelling home after our travels in California. When enquiring about the rate for our final 2 nights prior to booking the Manager said he would match the rate of our initial stay without even knowing what the rate was. It really was a wonderful experience staying at the Solamar Hotel. Thankyou to the Manager and Christian the Head Chef who took the time to speak to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Pet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: proreach
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what we expected. The location was perfect (next to Gaslamp District), the room was small, but very comfortable (and quiet). The hotel is right next door to Petco Park (the Baseball Stadium). It was very close to many restaurants, and nightlife. Also, this hotel is very "Dog" friendly. We did not bring our dog on this trip but found it very entertaining seeing all guests with there dogs. My only disapointment is that the parking at the hotel is/was $32/night, however, I think you would encounter similar costs to park at any of the near by hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Mojo”
Reviews.Author: Eiregirl
Reviews.Content: This is one hotel that we would return to in a heartbeat. And that's saying something...for all the travelling that we do, we rarely want to try the same place twice. We chose the Solamar in the beginning because of their pet policy. Our sweet hound came along with us for a weekend beach get-away and this was the best $$ deal by far for a dog-friendly room. It's also in an awesome location in the Gas Lamp District of downtown San Diego...there are a lot of outdoor cafes in walking distance. Here's the best part - this hotel has so much great mojo that it can spread the love across the spectrum. My kids (8 & 10) loved the pool and the kid-friendly room. My dog loved...well, she just loved not being left behind. My husband & I loved the fact that all of this occured without losing the very adult flair of the hotel. We had a room on the 4th floor and left the kids in the room for an hour once the pool area converted to a nightclub. Appetizers and drinks under the stars - perfection. In addition to all of this, beds are great, the service very attentive, rooms are super clean and trendy and we got a break on the parking because we drive a hybrid. How cool is that? We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and chic downtown hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: RandynLori
Reviews.Content: We escaped the Bay Club Hotel and luckily got into the Hotel Solamar - what a difference! Amazing, comfy, clean and elegant rooms, fabulous and friendly service, and within walking distance of the fun Gaslamp district. The bar upstairs is super fun and great for yummy drinks and people watching. We paid a dollar extra and got a continental breakfast free each day, and it was delish - home baked pastries, freshly squeezed OJ, great coffee, and a bowl of fresh fruit. The wait staff could not be better, either. We purchased a full breakfast on one of the days and the food was exquisite (and I am super picky). The only downside was the parking was a whopping $32 a night...unless you drive a hybrid vehicle. Then it's 1/2 price. I'd come here to stay again in a heartbeat. LOVE THE HOTEL SOLAMAR!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as Kimptonesque...”
Reviews.Author: flannelpajamas
Reviews.Content: There's something distant and uncomfortable about this hotel, and I guess it's the little things that irk me. The good: 1. I was able to get a good two-day rate on the Kimpton website ($158.00) which is probably the only reason why I'm here. With the economy, my company is really scrutinizing my travel expenses. 2. The location is also convenient for food and walking around the Gaslamp District and it's less than three miles from the airport. 3. The decor is contemporary, but cold. Most Kimptons that I have been to are stylish and contemporary but not cold. I couldn't put my finger on it. 4. Nice big flat-screen TV. The not so good: 1. Yes, the location is convenient, but it's also really noisy. I don't know if other rooms are the same, but ask for a quiet room if they have one. 2. The bathroom sink is really high...so this is not so good for me at 5'3" but might be great for someone that's 6'3". Water splashes everywhere because the sink is too shallow and gets all over my things. The bathroom was clean, but generally smallish. 3. The hotel includes internet with the room cost, except there is no wireless or too weak of a signal. You have to be hard-wired to the internet cable which restricts your mobility. This irks me. 4. Valet parking is $32.00 a night...kind of an oxymoron decision to stay here for the cheaper room rate, but throw in parking...and well...you're back up to where you wanted to avoid in price. The Bad 1. The king-sized bed in my room was so uncomfortable, I barely slept. It dips on either side, and is slightly raised in the middle. Basically the bed felt like it was 100 years old and need to be thrown out. 2. The nice comforter I'm used to from Kimpton turned out to be so worn down and thin, I thought they forgot to include a comforter in my bed. I basically had to get up at 3am and put on my fleece jacket, because I was freezing to death. 3. No IN-room coffee. So I ordered room service for breakfast, and my coffee that came with room service tasted like water. I couldn't believe how weak it was for $4, plus 22% gratuity, plus $3 service charge. I probably could have bought a coffee maker for that price. They do serve coffee in the lounge in the morning until 9:30am, but who wants to go down there in the morning when there's work to do or in my case trying to get a little more sleep due to the lumpy bed? In summary: I'm not coming back...based on the bed issue alone...and I really wanted to like this place. I still gave this place a good rating, because it is MOSTLY good for the average person on vacation...really bad for business person. There might be better beds in other rooms, and I just happened to have the worst room in the house. Maybe you get what you pay for at the Kimpton.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Saroo72000
Reviews.Content: Relatively to its price, the hotel was a semi-disappointment. The rooms are very small, bathrooms even smaller, staff not too impressive, restaurant decent but overpriced for the limited menu and slow service. We enjoyed San Diego and luckily didn't spend much time in the hotel. And what is up with the drunks across the hallway? Don't mind an occasional friendly drunk but banging on my door at 2 am? Made me cranky.

Reviews.Title: “Not Priceline Friendly, Problems with Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cefiro06
Reviews.Content: I am assuming and hoping that the problems that I ran into were because I booked the rooms on priceline for less than half the rack rate from the hotel's website, because if this is the norm for their regular paying customers some people need to be fired. My biggest complaint was with a lady that was working the front desk overnight. When we arrived I requested rooms with two queen beds. We were told that there were none available (which was okay). After completing our stay I realized that the hotel was very empty for our entire stay. I also requested extra keys as we had a larger party. I was told that they were out of keys and could only provide one per room! The next night, we came back a little late and we needed our room key to get into the front door. Because we were only given one key, we didn't have a key with us and the same lady that checked us in quickly offered us TWO extra keys (one for each of our rooms). After pulling up our room in the computer, she handed me ONE key and said goodnight. The next day, I found out that the new key worked just fine, but the original key had been deactivated!! After asking I was quickly given extra keys for both rooms by a much nicer girl at the front desk (during the day). I hope it was just a coincidence or computer error but if she pulled this because we got a good deal on the rooms she should be fired or Solamar should not sell rooms through Priceline. My other big complaint was with the stench in the hallway. Many times when we returned to our rooms we could immediately smell the stench of bathroom (#2) as soon as we entered the hallway. The vent that is near the elevator must be for the bathrooms as you can see it as soon as you get off of the elevator. Even our guests immediately noticed this. Also, the $32 valet service was not what I expected for that price. The valets were friendly, but we waited way too long for our cars to be retrieved (up to 10 minutes). Also, when we returned late one night the valet (24 hours) was nowhere to be found. We had to stand around for another 10 minutes and notify the front desk before anyone came out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, friendly staff but had a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: srfa
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I stayed a sat night; the beds were comfortable even though we had to switch rooms because they only gave us a king to start out with when we had two queens specified on the reservations. The free continental breakfast was decent although it's a sit down where you have to be waited on and tip the waiter. We only got the continental breakfast after making a call to the front desk and asking how we would get it and then we had to go to the front desk and tell them it should have been on our reservation. We got a great deal on it so it was worth the price we paid after we got everything our reservation was for but I don't know if it would be worth the asking price on the web site. It is a great location with a nice pool and good food at the bar, although $32 for overnight parking is a lot to swallow.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, clean/modern rooms. . . we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: diatsuzuk
Reviews.Content: I was trying to find a great place to stay for my 40th birthday getaway and got lucky on Hotwire.com with the Hotel Solamar. The staff was friendly and welcoming. The rooms were clean (includes Aveda amenities). I won't lie the $32/night rate to park our car (valet service) was a little steep, but that's to be expected in downtown San Diego. I read through all the reviews and was a little nervous, as I didn't know what to expect, but upon staying there, we couldn't be happier. The hotel has a great location. Once we parked, we were able to walk everywhere, including shopping at Shorelines Gallery on Market / 4th. The bar at the pool also has great nightlife. I read reviews that the music could be a bit loud, but our room was on the opposite side, and we didn't hear a thing. We will definitely be back for another weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “just didn't do it”
Reviews.Author: mpdu2
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights for a business trip. Got a great rate on Expedia which Kimpton matched. Also got a suite upgrade thru their e-upgrade program. Thank god I did as even the suite seemed small. Overall I wanted to like it so much more than I did as I had heard all these great things about Kimpton , but it just didn't come together. Staff were young and nice, but not as crisp as they should have been. No one opened doors for you, staff greeted you with "hey, what's up?". Bartender at the pool watched TV instead of coming over to the cabanas to see if we wanted cocktail service. For a new hotel I was surpirsed at how "banged up" our room was. The bed had an incredible sag on one side. (We even checked the bed frame to see if it was broken.) Remember that this is a downtown hotel so the views are non-existent. (Our room overlooked a parking lot) None of these things are really major but for $350 a night? Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in Great Location in Gaslamp District”
Reviews.Author: dburkett
Reviews.Content: Hotel Solamar is another fine example of a Kimpton Hotel - chic and swanky. Its location is ideal with respect to the gaslamp district. It is in walking distance to many fine restaurants, a movie theater and Petco park. It is an amitious walk to Balboa Park but it is certainly is an option for most. The hotel was clean and appeared to be newer. The pool / bar area is very nice although I am not sure everyone would be comfortable with the pool area being combined with the bar. The hotel offers complimentary wine each evening in the lobby for an hour. I would highly recommend this hotel to adults. I am not sure it is the best selection for those traveling with children. If you are staying at Hotel Solamar you must visit Heavenly Cupcake across the street and up a block or two. It is a cupcake lounge - serving only cupcakes. A great little treat!

Reviews.Title: “All around excellent - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: meellos
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 4 night stay at the Hotel Solamar and were thoroughly pleased with the hotel. It's location is excellent - about 1-2 blocks from the main strip in the Gaslamp Quarter, and about 2 blocks from Petco Park. We never felt like we were too far from anywhere. Taxi service was always readily available, about $15 to the airport, $6 to the Coronado ferry/Midway, or $10 to the zoo. The hotel was super clean, and the staff were super friendly and very helpful. The hotel restaurant (J-Six) provided a solid (if pricey, $30+) breakfast. Some here on Trip Advisor complain that the room was small - ours seemed fine for two people. The hotel wine reception every night at 5pm was a social hit - the lobby area was always packed with people enjoying each other's company. The lobby area was very attractive, and provided a comfortable social setting with its comfy couches and open fireplaces. This was our first stay at a Kimpton brand hotel, and I can only sum up this review by saying that we're definitely on the look-out now for more Kimpton hotels! If you're looking for a smaller boutique hotel in the Gaslamp or near Petco Park, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “okay hotel , not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: jassmi4
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel solamar in med january. my boss had given the trip to sandiego at this hotel to me for x-mas. i grew up in sandiego and love it . i know he paid alot of money for the room we got and he was looking for a high quality hotel with a good laocation. when we drove in we were met by a valet that the first thing he said was . the price to park here is blah blah and how do you plan on taking care of that. i told him and he told me to go check with the front desk. we felt somewhat like it was a little tacky and not real top notch service to be greated that way. took awhile to get the right person to be able to see that it was included in our sty by my boss. my first impression of the room was it was not well kept up, wall paper peeling,a sqished bug on the roof and or view was looking over an ally that was really very ugly. had i paid for it i would have been very disappointed with the quality of the room and the staff did not exude friedliness, even the guy at the pool bar seemed to lack any personality or great customer service. the location was good because you were right in the gaslamp and the shopping and restaurants but i would have preferred to stay somewhere else especially for the price. at night there is a bar on the roof across the street so unless you really like to stay awake listening to the boom boom boom all night until 2-3 am then you probably want to stay elsewhere. i felt the hotel needed more polish, better customer service and it totally lacked the feel of a higher class establishment. the freet breakfast in the hotel was a real value, great food and you could add other items on the menu other than the just what they offered for free, like bacon hashbrowns for a min cost.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Solamar”
Reviews.Author: rowingman
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate by using hotels.com, then calling the hotel which met the rate, so what should I expect? After listening to the CEO of Kimpton indicate they have "the highest guest approval rating", frankly I would have expected more. I am not a complainer, but having heard Kimpton brag about tripadvisor feedback, here is honesty: Room was average, but mattress was worn (sagging). Fitness room is small to non-existent (two treadmills, one bike, one elliptical) and only opens at 7am (which they do not tell you, because there is no "hotel guide" in the room explaining hotel features). For the Kimpton window dressing about "green hotels" the outdoor heated pool was steaming in the January morning, and the outdoor fireplace was left on all night (Al Gore would not be happy). Worse, after finding the entire fitness room occupied at 5am (one needs to go to the front desk, and security will open it on request) I went out into the pool area to swim, the door closing behind me, and you are locked onto the pool deck (before business hours, this being a 5am swim in the dark), and your card key does not get you back inside. Only by knocking on the door of the crowded fitness room did I get back indoors. After the 2am wakeup from the drunks coming back into the bldg after closing time (security called not by me, but altercation was loud in the hallway), trying to replicate my early morning swim (propping the door this time) only to find the pool filthy and not venturing in, waiting 35 minutes for two poached eggs, two coffees, two toasts, one smoothie ($30+ thank you very much), and replying to the check out clerk when asked "how was everything" indicating that I found the workout room too small for the hotel, was told, "oh, you can use the health club across the street, we have a reciprocal agreement" I thought that management has a way to go with respect to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton's are Reliable”
Reviews.Author: miamitola
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night at Hotel Solamar. It has a great location in the gaslamp district and was in walking distance to great restaurants and the movie theater. We stayed on the eigth floor in a king bed room. The rooms are small, but they have all the amenities, LCD TV, refrigerator and nice bathroom. If you stay in rooms from _21 through _33 you will be facing the roof deck pool. The night we were staying was a little loud until after midnight. Also, you pretty much have to valet your car. It's $32 for the night, except for our hybrid the price was cut in half!!! I love the idea of the wine hour (which we did not go to) but we did enjoy the complimentary coffee and tea in the morning. The staff were nice and helpful. We are fans of Kimpton hotels but got a better deal when we booked through expedia, versus their website. They would not allow us to use add the room to our rewards card because we booked throuh a third party. They suggested that next time we call Kimpton, tell them the deal we could get, they'll match it and then we can get our rewards.

Reviews.Title: “Week of Calm”
Reviews.Author: sivartyad
Reviews.Content: A week long stay at Hotel Solamar could not have made for a better end to the year. THe hotel is uber chic and modern, the room (a Vista suite, I think?) was extremely spacious with separate living area, mini bar with quality products, awesome restaurant/room service. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful in moving me from one room to another (because of the length of stay they insisted that I have a suite because of my Kimpton membership level) but it was not available on the first night of my stay, so they moved all my things for me (packed, of course!) on the following morning. Nearly every person at the front desk could speak to me by name and the room service attendants were perhaps the MOST friendly exhibiting actual social skills while standing there waiting for you to sign-off on the bill. Very rare! The hotel's location is amazing and offers so many opportunities for dinner and other strolling around town. Highly encourage anyone traveling to San Diego to stay at this hotel! Not to mention that Kimpton often runs great specials like the one I received for this stay: stay 5 nights or more and receive 50% off your entire stay. That's INCREDIBLE!

Reviews.Title: “we love it”
Reviews.Author: Rolix
Reviews.Content: Great location, in the heart of San Diego.... almost walking distance to everythings. Hotel is well decorated... the room is beautiful and comfortable, the view.... the spa tub.... the large shower...........all the staff are great and well professionl... except the concierge, she was a little unpleasant. Complimentary coffee in the morning and complimentary wine hour in the evening, .....don't forget to try the breakfast is SUPER !!!

Reviews.Title: “great location stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: cemm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for an inexpensive get-away to San Diego and got a great price on this hotel! We were only staying 1 night so we took the city bus from the airport and walked the 4 blocks to the Solamar. The hotel was in a great location and the rooms were beautiful. They have a complementry wine hour in the lobby and a coffee service in the morning that was excellent. We toured the Midway the first afternoon-totally worth the 17.00 admission fee! The next day we took the water taxi to Coronado Island and had lunch before our flight home. Had a great time for a song-we would recommend this hotel to anyone. The pool is small with no hot tub-we didint use it and it was largely abandoned during our stay.The only problem we had was with internet access. The morning of our departure we could not connect and was told the hotel was having issues with their computer system and to call their support number.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased With Stay”
Reviews.Author: Quinnly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a last minute trip to San Diego after getting good airfare. I had never booked with Priceline but gave it a shot. When we got the Hotel Solomar, I was only nervous because it wasn't the familiar Omni, Marriott, Hyatt chains but with a four star rating, I assumed it had to be in line with them. And the price was right for sure. The hotel is very chic and modern. The rooms are nice, but as couple posters have said, no dressers and that is slightly inconvenient if you have a longer stay as we did - 5 nights. But beds were comfy. The best part of hotel is staff. The front desk staff were amazing. Even when we had minor complaints or maybe requests, they tried to be as accomodating as possible and never made us feel they were put out. We did move once because we stayed during Halloween and a loud street concert was going on right out our window. They moved us to 10th floor which they didn't have to do. The view was amazing. City, litte of the ocean. Right now there is some construction going on at properties near the hotel. The only time it even bothered me was during the weekday by the pool. Hard to relax with the construction noise. Valet parking is pricey ($32) but if you go in and out a lot, its probably worth it than trying to find public parking. So much is within walking distance. Restaurants, Petco Park (for summer events especially), nice mall. All in all, I would recommend the hotel. I have heard that some rooms experience noise from the pool bar but I would think it would have to be extremely busy for that to happen. And yes, some ocassions they do close the pool to guests to accomodate a private party which does put you off a little. They only did that once during our stay so we didn't mind. The morning coffee and tea and the afternoon wine is a very nice extra touch as well. Go and have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton hotels are fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Atlantabeachlover08
Reviews.Content: I generally love Kimpton hotels, and Hotel Solamar is no exception. The hotel is beautiful, clean, comfortable, and in a great location. The staff are gracious and cordial. There are many amenities that truly make staying at a Kimpton a great travel experience. Hotel Solamar offers free tea and coffee in the lobby every morning, and free wine for an hour in the evening. There is free wireless in the rooms. The bathrooms are luxurious with great toiletries. I would definitely plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: randallbellaire
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of a 5 day stay at the Solamar while attending a conference in San Diego. We traveled with another couple and they echo our experience. We arrived hours before official check-in time, but received our rooms immediately. During our entire stay the staff was courteous, professional, and always assisting. Housekeeping service was efficient and excellent. The 4th floor roof top pool/bar is wonderful!! A great place for a relaxing drink in the evening with a view of the Gaslamp district. Never really saw anyone swimming, appears to be more of a social gathering place for guests. The hotel location cannot be beat.
