Walking distance to just about everything including the convention center and the Gaslamp district which is full of restaurants, shops, pubs, etc. You dont need a car if you are staying in this district. We took taxis to/from the airport and San Diego Zoo, very reasonable taxi rates. The hotel has a free wine tasting every evening from 5p to 6p, very nice. Free coffee in the lobby every morning for 3 hours or so. The decor is wonderful, if you like W hotels, you will like the Solamar. The hotel was spotless as far as cleanliness is concerned and the hotel is well maintained. Great down bed comforters and pillow. A room with a view of the 4th floor pool/bar deck was nice. Although the hotel really doesnt have a bay view, you cant beat the location, ambience, and service. This would be a great place to stay for a romantic couples retreat. Highly recommend this hotel and we will stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Eskimo_Monkey_Travel
Reviews.Content: We landed at San Diego Airport at about 4.30pm on a Sunday afternoon and took a cab the 10 min drive to the Solamar. We were welcomed by the very friendly concierge with a nice glass of wine (they have wine tasting every evening between 5pm and 6pm). The hotel has a lovely 'living room' area to relax after a day exploring San Diego. There is of course the JSix pool bar to also have a few drinks. The room was spacious, clean and quiet. They have Aveda toiletries in the bathroom. The hotel has a fantastic location on 6th and J Street. It's about a 20 min walk to the Coronado Ferry, 15 mins to Seaport Village, 2 mins to the Altitude Skybar and 2 mins to a fantastic seafood restaurant called The Oceanaire, even San Diego Zoo is walkable in about 40 mins. All the staff were exceptionally friendly. Probably a 4.5* really, but excellent all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: smalld
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at the hotel. they gave us a grea corner suite (601) for friday and saturday night. we were originally booked into the IVY hotel but changed due to some reviews that mentioned the nightclubs could be noisy. when we checked in we told them that and they assured us we would have a "quiet" stay. Got back to the Hotel last night and there was a roof top nightclub accross the street that had music blaring so loud our room was shaking. when we called down they offered two suggestions: 1. they would send up a fan to drown out the noise (seriously), and / or 2. they would send up ear plugs. since they would have needed a jet engine t put out the noise i went wth the ear plugs. called down this morning and they had no notation on the file that we were displeased. they offered us another room and when we insisted on a refund for that night they argued. they finally offered it after agreeing that this is a well known problem and they get frequent complaint about it. Our new room is not as nice but nice enough. Now at the pool and at 4pm i am told they are closing the pool area and we have to move to facilitate a wedding. This was not told to us when we checked in and in my opinion is unacceptable. There are no other exterio common areas to use. So not impressed. tons of choices in this city and this will never be our choice again. it is too bad as the location is great, hotel is very nice, valets are great, and the concierge was amazing. The hotel managers need to be re-trained in their people skills and although problems do arise they need to be able to resolve them. We travel the world and this is the worst back to back experiences we have had where the hotel has absolutely failed to resolve anything.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Solamar: Gaslamp District, San Diego: A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobLibertyOnThePark
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Solamar is a boutique hotel with amazing amenities and in the heart of San Diego's Gaslamp or Downtown District. Built in 2005, this hotel exemplies fine living and features large rooms with quality and stylish furnishings; oversized bathrooms with large tubs and great showres; a most hospitable and welcoming staff; plus a rooftop pool and lounge. It's within minutes of so many restaurants from casual to fine dining. Petco Park is very close by as well as Horton Paza for shopping. I stayed here a week and loved every minute! Please note there are no dressers in the room which is a little inconvenient, but really no big deal. Every evening there's wine tasting from 5:00 to 6:00 P.M. It's free and well attended. Although the Solamar is expensive, you definitely feel like you're getting very good value as this is a really good place to stay and I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FlowergirlMichigan
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of staying at this lovely hotel...we loved this place the moment we arrived. The valets were so polite...Mollie greeted us the moment we walked in, gave us fresh water with lemons & limes...complimentary wine tasting in the evening, complimentary coffee in the morning...she set up hair appointments for us...the valets were always professional, the front desk staff was so courteous & pleasant, the young man who brought our bags to our room was so nice & polite... a "boutique" hotel - small, yet personal, everyone who worked there was extremely polished, professional & friendly..the rooms were clean & beautifully decorated.....WE LOVED OUR STAY HERE!!! Loved everything about this hotel....and, it is in a great location...close to everything...would highly recommend this hotel to anyone & everyone...

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Weekend Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Dominici
Reviews.Content: Expedia had a great deal per night at the Hotel Solamar, so I booked a long weekend stay. The lobby of the hotel was very clean and modern and the check-in service was very prompt. As we entered our room on the sixth floor, we were pleasantly surprised. The colors were nice, the amenities were great, and the overall comfort and cleanliness of the room was perfect. The hot tub is a must. The walls are a little thin, but luckily it didn't turn into a problem. Overall, the location and price of the hotel would bring me back for another visit. You are within walking distance to so much, including Petco Park, if you are there for a game. The Gaslamp District is right there with many restaurants to choose from. My suggestions...Mary Jane's Coffee Shop for breakfast and Lou and Mickey's for dinner. They won't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTCPD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a romantic getaway and it was delightful!!! Our "travel agent" booked us here and downgraded our room without our authorization. When we went to check in and found out about the downgrade (for the same price!), we brought it to the attention of the hotel staff. They contacted the manager and within 10 minutes, we had one of the best rooms in the hotel on the top floor. The staff went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of which is more than I can say for our "travel agent". The hotel is just awesome! The rooms are beautiful and the location is well, location, location, location. We stayed in a room facing the bar/pool and we did not hear the noise others complained about and we left our windows open. The room was amazing, clean, spotless, with wonderful shower and hot-tub. We can't say enough good things about the Hotel and the Staff. They were absolutely delightful. We felt like we were staying at "Hotel Babylon" for you BBC fans. One thing about parking. "Park It On Market" is just around the corner on Market St and costs half as much as the Solomar.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It...Great 5 night stay”
Reviews.Author: dcdwntwn
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to post a note that I loved the Hotel Solamar. I got it for 5 night through Priceline. The hotel is modern and clean and in a great location in the Gaslamp. There were hundreds of restaurants and bars in the proximity. A bonus is that Long's Pharmacy is next door so if you need anything like toothpaste or whatever, you can just run over. The bathrooms were great and I bought bath salts and took baths most days...drinking a free glass of wine from the daily wine tasting at 5PM. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisaChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the hotel and had a very nice stay here. The rooms are very spacious and the beds are quite comfortable. They offer a complimentary coffee bar every morning and a wine reception every evening. The location is central to shops and restaurants. The pool and bar on the fourth floor are alot of fun. The only complaint I have is the very poor water pressure in the shower. I know they are trying to conserve water, but when it takes two to three times as long to rinse the shampoo from your hair, it kind of defeats the purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Nice Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: WorldAdventurer_7
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at a Kimpton property and I must say they have a nice track record going. Love the hotel and room decor. Service is always the pampered, kind, courteous treatment I think we would all love from every travel related chain. Free wine in the evenings, flexibility to get you whatever you or to wherever you need to go. I am typically wary of posters who are this positive about a place, but, I can't imagine any of what I have written above to be hyperbole.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: weloveholidaysNewark
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Virgin holidays as it was the best price we could find. The hotel is great. Ths staff were all fab and friendly, the rooms were very clean and to a high standard and the free wine hour everyday is spot on. We had a room overlooking the pool, but as the bar closes at 12 it was never a problem to us. The atmosphere around the pool and bar area at night was great. The location is also ideal if you are looking at being near all the bars and restaurants in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Hbmomof4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Solamar for a one night escape from our kids. It did not fail us in that respect. The decor was contemporary and inviting. The hotel is close to everything downtown...within walking distance. We even had an awesome view of Petco park from our room. The Gaslamp quarters night life is vibrant and offers a good diversion if that's what you're looking for. What we didn't care for was the hard bed and the annoyed desk help who didn't appreciate that we paid our parking fee in cash. (He seemed put out that we didn't want to put it on our credit card.) The parking rate was a little steep ($32) but was worth it when the other alternative was parking in the open lot across the street. Overall, the experience was very good. We wish we could have stayed more than one night...maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: JulianNewbury
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the solomar aug 25th - aug 28th 2008. Very nice, and clean 4star hotel which deserves 4 stars! The mood and lighting is very sombre in the public area's, and the check in girls are very pretty (for us guys!!!) The room was very nice, and the bathroom rocked. The only down side is the pool area. The area itself is absolutely great, but I think they have pool parties, and sometimes after a hard day all you want to do is pop down the pool at 4pm have a lay and have a swim, but you kinda feel a little out of place walking through with your towel and shorts, when everyones dressed up and stood at the bar listening to loud music! But this didn't deter me

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mfost
Reviews.Content: This was a decent hotel. We chose it because so many of the other hotels in the Gaslamp area were extremely overpriced, and we were looking for a hotel with a nice pool. We booked this online through expedia for about 150 per night, and it was certainly worth that amount. The rooms were clean, done in a pretty beachy decor, and were comfortable. The maids always did a good job of keeping the room in order, although they never seemed to leave us enough towels (2 towels for 2 ppl isn't enough in my opinion)...so we just requested more, which was no problem. The hotel is busy. There are lots of people there at night, especially in the pool area. Our friends had a room over the pool and they said that the noise at night wasn't an issue. The pool is beautiful and gets great sun. However, there isn't much space for lounging. They have about 6 lounge chairs out, and 3 cabanas. One day we arrived in the afternoon and there was no place to lie out. When I asked the bartender where we were supposed to sit, he kindly offered up the cabana for free (for which they normally charge $250 per day). On our last day we also noticed that they had a stack of lounge chairs behind the bar, which you can take and set up if you want to. The pool was pretty and a lot of fun! The hotel is within walking distance to some clubs, restaurants and bars, and they offer you free coffee and tea in the morning, which is a nice touch. Now for my gripes. I didn't find the hotel to be overly functional. I compare it to a really hot girl without a brain. The rooms looked nice but there was no good area for putting on makeup, and there was a lack of counter space and shelving. The pool looked beautiful, but the lack of sitting space was a bit annoying and somewhat stressful. They have sex kits for purchase in the room - lubricant, condoms, etc. I guess paying $7 for a sex kit when in dire need is worth it, but I don't need to be reminded of the thousands of people who have had sex in the bed that I'm paying $150 per night for! Yuck! They also have these strange leopard housecoats for purchase. These two things made me think that the hotel might secretly be frequented by pimps and people with weird sexual fetishes. Finally, parking was $30 per day - insane! We had no real problems with this hotel, but I just didn't find it functional enough overall. See what else you can find, but if this is the hotel you end up with, then that's certainly okay, too, and I'm sure you'll have an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Sad Little Gym”
Reviews.Author: boston02118
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel. The good: the room was clean and well-appointed. Beds were very comfortable and sheets were high quality. Great location (Petco Park is a block away; the convention center a couple of blocks; lots of restaurants in Gas Lamp District). Very friendly and polite staff. Small but well-maintained outdoor pool on the third level with a bar area. Very sleek and modern public areas. The bad: The ONLY downside to the hotel was the fitness facility. It was pretty lame. Few cardio options crammed into a tiny space. Too bad...I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat for a one night stay. But anything more than that, I'd look for a hotel with a better fitness room. Kimpton, put a decent fitness room in the hotel -- it would pay off in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay, but loud and poor service”
Reviews.Author: linegem
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel two weeks ago for 4 nights, starting on a Saturday. The rooms were nice, pretty clean, and the location is good. But the noise in this Hotel was too much. The pool area features a roof bar that is open until the wee hours of the morning, with plenty of booze-filled people and music blasting... The walls were pretty thin & my neighbor's child was up at 6am - could hear almost all of their conversation. I mentioned this to staff, but they shrugged it off as I am sure they have heard it before. Bottom line: if you choose to stay at this Hotel, request a room on a high floor, not overlooking the pool area. Given the choice, I would stay at another Hotel, especially if you value sleep & freindly service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely botique hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller100
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in August 2008. Overall, I am really satisfied with this hotel. It is worthy of the 4-star title. The decor, both in the lobby and in the rooms, was artistic and tasteful, and the service at the front desk was excellent. They also offered free coffee/tea in the morning and free wine tasting in the afternoon, everyday. Though I was not able to take advantage of the wine tasting, by the number of people who did everyday, I gathered the wine couldn't be too bad. My only complains are: (1) the room was just a bit too small, so only one soft chair was provided -- I would have preferred two, so both my mom and I could sit comfortably. (2) The newly-renovated bathroom had a really shallow sink. While it is stylish, it is really not very practical. Oh, also, the valet parking was expensive -- $32 a day! But I took the advice of other trip-advisor reviewers, and parked in a nearby covered parking lot for $8/day. Complementary wired high-speed Internet is really nice! If I visit San Diego again, I would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Solamar and Meeting San Diego”
Reviews.Author: CFANTAUZZI
Reviews.Content: This August was our first trip to San Diego so we picked this hotel and it was just fantastic. Took in a Padres game so it was a short walk to the stadium and back. Enjoyed drinks on the roof with the fire pots going that night. As it was my birthday, the whole setting was just right. We're New Yorkers and we were totally impressed by the hotel's location and setting, as well as the West Coast feel of SD. We'll definitely come back and revisit the Solamar and spend more time in the city and sail the harbor again. Thanks San Diego, and thanks to the Hotel Solamar for our great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: relliebelle
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Solamar was great place to stay for my quick visit to San Diego. We booked a regular king room, but were given a corner king room, which gave us a view of Petco park and the fireworks after the game. The hotel is very close to restaurants and shops in the downtown area and is also close to the major highways. The staff at the hotel were very nice, they gave us a coffee maker for the room and the valet guys were friendy as well. The decor is really funky and fun and the small details in the room and throughout the hotel were nice. There are only two things that I did not like - the pool is small and our bathroom only had a light behind the mirror, which did not provide any light in the shower. Overall, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Solamar - trendy hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: LindaNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Hotel Solamar is a fashionable hotel on 6th Avenue. Rooms are tastefully decorated (trendy). The Hotel has a bar on the 4th floor, next to the (small) pool. The bar at the pool is quite popular, and music is being played during the weekends. I did stay in a room on the 4th floor but I could not really hear the music in my room. The gym is disappointing, it is very very small. The Convention Center is on walking distance and the baseball stadion is just a block away. So are the bars and restaurants on 4th and 5th avenue. Hotels in San Diego are extremely expensive. Hotel Solamar is affordable, clean, and a good choice for San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bplus
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute stay at the Solamar for our anniversary on a Monday night. The hotel was well decorated and was just as we expected. They sent a bottle of champagne up for our special night and we enjoyed the pool, wine, and coffee in the morning. We stayed on the pool level and it was really quiet on the weekdays. I would recommend the hotel to anyone, though we did park down the street to avoid the expensive valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JamesBondMI6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week and had a very good experience. Based on some of the other reviews about the noise level at the pool, we requested a "quiet room" and were placed on the top floor(10th) on the opposite side of the building. We spent several days and evenings at the pool but avoided the weekend and the wild scene on those days. This worked out perfectly. The room and hotel itself were very clean and had a nice decor. The staff was friendly and helpful. The best part is the location. The hotel is within walking distance of many, many attractions, restaurants, bars, shops and galleries. Even the walk to the zoo and back was manageable. We also went to two Padres games at Petco Park, which is literally one block from the hotel. We would definitely stay here again on a return trip to San Diego. Just request a quiet room and avoid the pool on the weekend if you're not into the party scene.

Reviews.Title: “Great base in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: rogar
Reviews.Content: My wife and i booked our stay here through hotwire at a great price (well, i think so) of $139 per night. I had already been warned by previous reviews about the parking costs and as expected it was $32 (plus tips) to park here. Therefore, i completely ignored the car park and parked at the enclosed multi story car park about 100 metres along the road. There were a choice of two car parks and i parked from approx 6pm to 10am the following days and it cost me $8 per night - a much better deal! The reception staff were very friendly and they offer complimentary tea/coffee in an hour slot in the morning and wine between 5-6pm in the evening. The rooms were very clean and funky. They weren't huge in size but the decor was pretty fun and the tiger skin print dressing gowns a nice touch! Our room overlooked the pool/bar area and couldn't really hear any noise when inside the room and we enjoyed an evening drinking by the fire in this area. The massive plus to this hotel is the location. The gaslamp is full of bars and restaurants and the hotel is in the heart of this area. Overall - an excellent choice for a young couple but not the ideal choice for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GivenItToYouStraight
Reviews.Content: Hotel Solamar is located in the Party district of San Diego (Gas Lamp district). The Hotel is very clean and the staff and service there are excellent. The rooms are nice but a tad small. There is not much drawer or closet space for your clothes especially if there is more than 2 people staying in one room. The beds are very comfortable. The Pool is very small, you won't be swimming in this pool its there just to cool off . This Hotel is not a small kid family hotel, due to its location and the parties that go on there Thursday to Sunday.... Overall I like this hotel but if I come back I think I will check the other hotels out. The biggest gottcha at the Hotel is that if you want to park at the hotel there is a charge of $32.00 a day! (ouch). Parking in the Gas Lamp Distirct is pretty tough but there are paid parking lots.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, ridiculous pool scene”
Reviews.Author: rosco101
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is destroyed by the most bizarre pool scene I have ever come across in all my years of travelling. Im in my early 30's and my girlfriend in her late twenties and we found it way too much. At the weekend they bring in a local DJ from about 11am who plays unbelievably loud dance music right throughout the day, you cannot hear yourself think nevermind talking. The pool has hardly any beds but at the weekend when it fills up with obnoxious drunk people that the DJ brings with him you cant get a spot in the pool nevermind a sun lounger. They also rent out the cabanas so you may arrive down at 9 in the morning to be greeted with reserved signs on all the beds which sit their idle for most of the day because even when the beautiful people who booked them arrive they only want to be seen drinking in the pool. The pool area itself can be rented out to businesses and during one night of our stay was completely shut off to guests. If your a party animal you will of course love this vibe at the weekends but this is certainly not the place you want to go to at the weekends if you have children or just want to relax. One other thing about this hotel is the car parking, between tipping the valet and the car park fee be prepared to pay at least $40 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Kimptons are different but great”
Reviews.Author: cobwabo
Reviews.Content: The Solamar is a typical Kimpton hotel where each one surprises because of its modern, tastefully decorated rooms and the unusually relaxed staff. They are very dogfriendly and are the only ones that I know of that do not charge a dime for your dog to come with you. We enjoyed the stay in the Gaslampquarter and will come back here.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay with your dogs in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: codobai
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a hip, sleek place with a cool, modern decor, perfectly located to be a convenient launching pad to walk the Gaslamp/Harborside/East Village neighborhoods. Petco Ballpark is a couple of blocks away. The 4th floor pool is neat. The staff was super-friendly too. The few down points were the noise levels from the neighboring rooms and the rather sluggish air conditioning. The weather was warm during our stay and we had a hard time cooling the room down. Our dogs were welcomed (a gem among the San Diego hotels) but they didn't get the special turndown service advertised. Nonetheless we had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Not for sun bathers”
Reviews.Author: yellabelly
Reviews.Content: Everything about hotel was fine except for the pool area. If you're from Northern Europe you like to relax by a pool when the sun is shining. But at Solomar there are only 8 sun loungers, not nearly enough for a large hotel. While we were there a company held a meeting in pool area, we were on vacation trying to forget about work and some lady was in tears at this meeting over a grievance she had at work. I feel it's more of a business hotel than a holiday resort. Otherwise the hotel was excellent in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Lewy8
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Solarmar is a lovely boutique hotel with great aesthetics & very clean. We stayed for 6 nights, in early June and the location was perfect! We are pretty independent tourists, I had planned most of our activities before we arrived; but Timin, their Concierge, was great by pointing out the various places throughout the Gaslamp District to be sure to check out during our stay. And he gave us a real variety, not just several places all doing the same thing. If you plan on visiting La Jolla, we cannot recommend ENOUGH, "LaJolla Kayak" (with the blue awnings, on the 2 opposite corners of Ave. de la Playa). The staff will seriously go out of their way for you. Most of their Guides have lived their whole lives in La Jolla, & they care a lot about the area, so they make the tours educational and great! Kevin & I cannot thank Mike and Dre enough for everything. If you go anywhere else, you just might be crazy... :) Favorite bike & kayak tours: La Jolla Kayak, for sure!! Favorite restaurant: Panevino Favorite breakfast: Cafe 222 Best beer selection: The Yard House Best fish tacos: Kotija Jr. (Encinitas) Favorite baseball: The Storm (Lake Elsinore) Biggest disappointment: Taka Sushi Favorite Cabbie: Tres McFadden

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: motonica
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel to celebrate his birthday along with our anniversary. The place was perfect. Very clean, very modern, great location, wonderful service, cool/young vibe. The rooms were very clean with a nice hip decor. Our window looked over to Petco Park, and we even walked over and watched the team practice on opening day. The rooftop pool was great even though we didn't really get to take a dip because the weather was a bit chilly. Although I must say they didn't have too many lounge chairs so I'm assuming if you don't get there early enough to get a spot then you're out of luck. They had a great poolside party one of the afternoons with a DJ and a large young crowd of partiers. We loved it and had a great time... But I'm pretty sure it must have been very loud for the rooms that were overlooking the pool. So I probably wouldn't recommend this hotel for older guests who are looking to relax. The location is also very central. It's a few blocks from the heart of gaslamp district and walking distance to Seaport village, the marina, convention center, and LOTS of great restaurants and bars nearby. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: mhernan44
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel room through Hotwire.com...I was crossing my fingers that I would be assigned to Hotel Solamar and luckily i was. i only stayed for one night but i was impressed during my short stay. pros: spacious rooms decorated very nice. beds were sooo comfy. Free Internet! excellent customer service: all staff was friendly. concierge put my friends and i on the guestlist for two near by clubs, the Ivy (the new place to be in SD) and Stingerray (right across the street). they offer a large variety of complimentary items in case you forgot something at home..my back was aching so i called the front desk and within minutes they sent up a heating pad. also it was raining that weekend, the hotel offered free umbrellas to their guests...i give 5 stars to the hotels attention to detail and remembering that even the little things count. free wine hour in the early evening and free starbucks coffee in the morning excellent location: walking distance from most of the clubs and popular shopping and dinning spots in gaslamp...and i think its walking distance from petco park because i saw a lot of people parking by our hotel then heading to the game. When staying in the gaslamp area some parts start to get a little seedy or ghetto, but not this location i felt safe when walking on the streets at night lots of parking options near by: luckily my friend and i found parking on the street, but you can easily find less expensive parking than the hotel's parking rate poolside bar/lounge located in the hotel: due to the rain it was closed but it looked like a very nice atmosphere. if you stay at the hotel you get free entrance and you dont have to wait in line. i would recommend this hotel for all ages. Its quiet hotel for those that would like to relax and get away but also close enough to walk to clubs for those party goers I will definitely return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: JennJack
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business recently and the experience was almost 100% positive. The registration clerk was unfriendly, but willingly gave me a room that did not overlook the pool (I had heard about the noise). The rooms are very nice and modern, with nice bathroom fixtures too. I had dinner alone at the restaurant (I think it is called "J") and this was a real treat. Extremely friendly and professional wait staff and I was seated in a private booth and did not feel self-conscious at all about eating alone. From the bread & tapenade to the delicious salad to the fantastic ravioli, everything was just perfect. Dessert was nice too. This is a very high class restaurant in a kind of touristy area and yet it is very reasonably priced for the quality. Breakfast was good, too, and when I told the waiter I was in a hurry he got me fed and out of there very quickly. If you are traveling to San Diego to go to a baseball game, I would highly recommend this hotel. I have also stayed at the Omni by Petco field and it is good, too. The Solamar will give you a more unique experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time at Hotel Solamar”
Reviews.Author: AP_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Hotel Solamar this past Memorial Day weekend. Stayed with a big group of friends and had a blast!! Trendy interior...Nicely appointed rooms. Great service at front desk and concierge. Stayed on the 4th floor..same level as the pool. Very social, fun place to hang out at hotel pool bar/cabana. Was also in a great location...walking distance to restaurants and nightlife. Would DEFINITELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ibct
Reviews.Content: We were treated so well from the time we arrived, to the time we checked out. Our rooms were beautiful and very clean, ,just like any other Kimpton hotel. The only problem that I experienced was the jets in my jacuzzi were broken. Someone came up to fix them during the day, and left a card that they were fixed, but they weren't. So, I had to call down again in the evening, and they sent someone else up; he was super curteous, but it took him a while; not sure how the guy before him could have said they were fixed because clearly, they were not. Other than that , I slept great and didn't find the hotel to be noisy at all, and my room faced the pool. I could see how it could be noisy if there was a big party going on though. We ate mostly at restaraunts in the Gaslamp - there are so many of them. They are good, but not as good as the Mexican restaurants in Old Town - I'd go there if you like good Mexican food.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: r_c311
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at this hotel the night of May 25. The hotel looked really nice from the moment we walked in. We were given a room on the 8th floor overlooking the pool on the 4th floor. The room was nice, clean and everything looked fine. We spent a few hours down at the pool/bar area. It would've been nice if the pool was a little bigger, as it seemed that the pool was too small for the size of the hotel. We still had a nice time down there. The location of the hotel is excellent. It's right next to the Gaslamp area and all the restaraunts and bars. If loud music bothers you and you need to be in bed before midnight, then you probably don't want to stay here. If you'd like to stay at a fun lively place and don't mind loud music during the day, you'll have a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “I love Kimpton hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Lola_travel_girl
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Solamar. This hotel is perfectly located; within walking distance to Horton Place (shopping mall), several galleries and shops and so many great restaurants. The rooms are modern, spacious and very comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. The pool area is gorgeous and luxurious. I highly recommend poolside drinks and lunch. The hotel serves complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby every morning and wine every evening. We appreciated this. The only thing that could be improved upon is the storage space in the rooms - we needed more drawers. I love this hotel and would never stay anywhere else when in San Diego! You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our anniversary weekend. We are Kimpton members, and were upgraded to a corner jacuzzi room by the cheerful check-in clerk. Our room was spotless, and had a nice view of Petco Park. The wine service from 5-6 is a nice touch. We even took our glasses to our room while we got ready for our night out on the town. We returned to the hotel around 12:30 a.m., and the hotel was very quiet. The beds were very comfortable too. We had no problems sleeping. Coffee and tea were served in the lobby each morning too. All in all, a very nice stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - Unique Design, Nice Vibe, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: usflyer
Reviews.Content: CONTEXT: Room rate for a single king was about $154 plus tax. First Kimpton hotel for us (normally Hilton/ Marriott people). GOOD: - Very cool stylish hotel with unique designs and great vibe. Mood lighting all around the hotel, fans in the halls, each floor has different mood, and the rooftop bar is very classy looking with fireplaces. - Staff were all VERY friendly and nice. They recommended that we try Richard Walker's Pancake House (5 minute walk from hotel), and this was GREAT. - Perfect location in gaslamp district with easy walking to the ballpark, limitless bars/ restaurants, and 10 minute walk to waterfront and park. - Free Starbucks coffee bar in the lounge in the morning. - Nice toiletries and amenities (although be careful what you use, as anything non-standard is charged here). BAD: - Hotel parking is a steep $20+ per night. We took the advice of a fellow traveler and drove 1-2 blocks on down 6th Ave and parked in the large 24 hour modern garage on the left. We parked at 7PM and left at 11AM and the total was a mere $8. CONCLUSION: My wife still talks about this hotel, and based on our stay here, we will be trying out more Kimpton properties in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Rude front desk staff, noisy, never again”
Reviews.Author: Wayfarer35
Reviews.Content: I lived in SD for 4 years and came back for a weekend getaway. In terms of location and aesthetics, this hotel was up to par with the other Kimpton hotels. It's very trendy, modern and bright. The decor is fabulous and the room itself was spacious and beautiful. It's centrally located so we were able to walk everywhere. We had some maintenance issues with the lighting and they were quick to resolve them. The maintenance staff was so friendly and made up for the rude front desk staff. Too bad we didn't get the actual room we initially reserved (smoking room but we complained so they switched us to the non-smoking room, no jacuzzi tub, located near the pool area). Despite its appearance, there were too many cons to this hotel: 1) RUDE front desk staff. From the onset, they gave us huge attitude as if they were only used to dealing with celebs and we were a waste of time. Even when correcting their errors, they acted as if they were doing us a favor. Perhaps they were overwhelmed because it was a holiday weekend, but for a hotel of this magnitude I would assume they'd be used to the large number of guests. 2) We didn't get the room we reserved: smoking instead of non-smoking, no jacuzzi tub, overlooking the pool. There was no apology, just attitude. 3) NOISE. Oh my goodness. I enjoy a good party, music and a few beers just like everyone else. But I thought I was witnessing a taping of MTV Spring Break. The music started in the early afternoon and continued throughout the night. We left the hotel on purpose and walked around just to avoid the annoying house music. The pool area is full of scenesters and people looking to hook up so you can't relax. We didn't even mind the noise in the hallway because the noise from the pool overpowered it. 4) They brag about free tea and coffee in the morning, but they ran out of lids for coffee cups. When asked if they were going to get more, they stated flatly they ran out. Huh? I would never stay here again. It was obnoxious, loud and not worth the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Julia =Surrey”
Reviews.Author: gilplondon
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greeted by friendly staff and the Hotel was very modern and the rooms clean and comfy. Unfortunately I had a restless night as there was a continuous whining noise in the room, we saw reception the next day who offered to move us to another room on the same floor but checked the room before moving and the whining noise was also there so moved down to the 9th floor which was much quieter. We think we could hear the air conditioning onthe roof. We had dinner in the J restaurant and the meal was excellent though we wished we had booked as we had to wait 45 mins for a table. The location was very close to the restaurants and there was a nice atmosphere. Was disappointed with the trip to the zoo and enjoyed the harbour cruise. Found eating in San Diego quite expensive. Hotel provided complimentary hot beverages in the morning and on request was provided with a cofee maker. Excellent stay and great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kristalynn25
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Hotel Solamar for 3 nights after winning it from a bid on priceline.com. We loved the modern, trendy decor and the upscale vibe. The staff was extremely friendly and we loved their wine hour in the evening. We would stay at Hotel Solamar in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location!”
Reviews.Author: ggirl27
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Solamar is a wonderful hotel near Petco Park and smack in the middle of the Gaslamp district. Perfect walking distance to the convention center. As other reviews have stated, it is quite noisy on Friday and Saturday nights, but the bar by the pool is great place to be on those nights! If you are planning on a nice quiet evening in on one of these nights I wouldn't count on it, but there really isn't a hotel in the gaslamp district that isn't affected by the nightlife on the weekend. The service here is fantastic! You'll feel like royality when you stay here. However, I would not recommend the hotel restaurant JSix. It is extremely expensive and small portions which would have been ok if the food was exceptional but it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Noise”
Reviews.Author: JackTheH
Reviews.Content: Like other Kimpton Hotels, this hotel has a unique, boutique feel to it with very cheery, helpful staff. I stayed here on a recent business trip without issue... until the Friday night, before my very early flight Saturday morning, I had a frustrating time getting sleep as I had to deal with the noise of the outside, pool-side bar. The noise, noticeably louder than previous nights, made me wonder if the hotel was more concerned for its 'scene' and the experience of those bar hoppers than those of their hotel occupants, some of whom need to, shockingly, sleep. I laid there contemplating, "Is this place a hotel or is it a bar?" If sleep is your preference, I advise you either avoid the side of the hotel facing the pool on the weekend, or avoid the hotel altogether.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: BostonPeter
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little apprehensive about booking rooms here for my second stay at a Kimpton Hotel (1st: Hotel Palomar, WDC, Oct '08). Soooo glad I placed more faith in Kimpton's outstanding service than in a couple negative reviews. The whole experience was fantastic from the moment I pulled up. Yes, the valet parking is expensive (everything is expensive in SD, and Solamar's rates are consistent with the market). Based on earlier reviews, was very careful to reserve a quiet room and specified away from and above pool level. Front desk offered me exactly what I asked for, but also offered an upgraded room away from the pool, but on the pool floor. Made the right choice by taking the upgraded room. The room was around the corner and as far from the pool as possible (#434). Stayed here a whole week and did not once hear a peep from the pool. Having spent about my share of time at the pool, I can believe that some of the lower pool facing rooms might have a valid complaint about the noise from the pool's bar--especially if they open their windows--so consider requesting a room away from the pool. One of the reviews complained about thin walls. Don't really know what they're talking about--that wasn't my experience. The side walls of the rooms are as quiet as anywhere else. Yes, you can hear your neighbors when they're talking too loudly in the hallway as they walk by. But that's no different that almost any other hotel I've stayed at (and I'm pretty sensitive to extraneous noise). If I have to find faults, they are these: (1) The hotel's exterior windows (at least my room's) are getting a __little__ dirty. They open, but not in any way that the hotel could wash them without hiring a professional window washer. This is probably not the sort of thing that would bother most guests, if they noticed it at all (the hotel, firmly in Downtown's center, doesn't enjoy views of the Bay); (2) Got some bad advice from staff member trying to be helpful responding to my subjective questions: was told "nothing to do at the Embarcadero" (it's a nearby park that might be useful for walking your dog at this pet-friendly hotel) and "free parking is tough up by Balboa Park" (that just totally wasn't my experience--maybe I was there on an off day?); (3) Not too thrilled with the light filtering curtain set up--they open & close with rods that are attached to the sheer fabric by a nut & bolt--a pretty flimsy setup that was wearing out in my room. Gee, that's my biggest complaint--closing the curtains. Life must be tough. Someone mentioned the guests are pretty young here, and that's right. All ages are represented, but the bell curve skews toward the late 20s/30s. During the Saturday night of my stay, Pepperdine U. had a formal event for some of their students, who were staying at the hotel--so my experience may not have been the norm. Surprisingly, heard no ruckus from these kids! Hotel has a great location in SD's Gas Light District. No shortage of things to do/places to eat. A 5 minute walk from the Convention Center. Oh, the 5-6PM wine hour is a great way to start off a crawl to the nearby restaurants. Hotel's restaurant (J Six) and poolside bar are very good. Both a little expensive (but still within market prices). Food was at least as good (had both dinner and breakfast here) as 75% of the nearby restaurants, but maybe a notch shy of excellent. Staff is __extremely__ helpful; if you've never stayed at a Kimpton, you'll just have to understand that this chain sets the standard for service quality. Everyone....front desk, restaurant/bar, valet, housekeeping, and maintenance goes out of their way to acknowledge you and make your stay as comfortable as possible. I'd unhesitatingly recommend this hotel to anyone going to stay in Downtown SD. It's not the cheapest hotel around, but it's worth it. There are also other choices nearby if you want to get lost in a megalithic hotel (e.g., Omni; Marriott; Grand Hyatt, all nearby). But if you want outstanding service in a first rate hotel with swanky styling and a great location, but with the classic warm feel of an inn, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “First Class!”
Reviews.Author: chirp78
Reviews.Content: I usually try to stay within the top 25 hotels reviewed on Trip Advisor but this hotel being listed at #35 gives me much hope for future hotel bookings. We booked the Solamar as a post cruise stay. We were treated like VIP's. Sean at the desk was especally gracious. They even held our friends from the ship, luggage as a courtesy, while we visited. We stayed in a corner room on the 9th floor, with a very deep spa tub. Everything was really clean (something I am always concerned about). The hotel has a very classy, contemporary feel to it. The rooms are much better looking in person than in pictures. The roof top pool and bar was a great place to hang out and have drinks and food (even a swim). Complimentary coffee in the morning in real mugs, crazy animal pattern robes, central to many things to do and see. Our stay was all that I was hoping for and more. The parking was $30 per day which I think is steep but it is catching on at many places. I believe you will love the Solamar

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Solamar: THE place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Denver_jetsetter
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to San Diego where we stayed at the Hotel Solamar for four days. This is a Kimpton brand hotel. It is located in the heart of the Gaslamp District, which is by far the best area to stay for entertainment and dining. Our room at the hotel was perfect. With a beach theme, leather walls, great view, and a comfortable bed we could not have asked for more. They have a wine hour everyday from 5pm to 6pm which is the best way to start off an evening there. They also have a roof top bar by the pool that is beautiful. The staff is some of the best I have ever seen in any establishment. They were extremely helpful with our needs within the hotel and throughout the city. The hotel definitely made our trip all the more memorable and we will be returning there as soon as possible. In one word the Hotel Solamar is: amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly Staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Spauly
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading other reviews on Tripadvisor. We had spent Christmas at the Argonaut Hotel in San Francisco and had been very pleased with this group of Hotels. The Hotel is located within walking distance of all the main shops, restuarants etc. Valet parking is available at $20 per day. When i travel I never skimp on incidentals and therefore do not object to paying for valet parking etc however there is a large public car park just across the road from the hotel where you can park for $14 dollars per day. One of the attractions of coming to this hotel was because it had a New Years Eve Party arranged, which we booked tickets for when I made the initial reservation. It wasnt until we got to the Hotel that we were informed that the party was being organised by an outside entertainment company and that the tickets at $75 dollars each did not include dinner. I did complain to the manager about this but regretably she was not very helpful saying that there was nothing they could do. In the end we had some room service food which was ok The party was really good however and everyone was very friendly which made celebrating the new year all that more enjoyable. Overall this is a really good place to stay. If i visit San Diego again I will certainly stay here!

Reviews.Title: “loved the solamar”
Reviews.Author: solamarfan
Reviews.Content: last year for the dreaded 50th birthday, i was fortunate enough to be able to stay at hotel solamar. from the minute we arrived i just knew it was going to be a fabulous weekend. the room was great, the bathroom was uber clean and swank. we wasted no time in heading to the pool bar, where we were served by a cheerful and helpful barman. as the sun went down the pool bar area morphed into a very pleasant rooftop lounge bar. it was extremely relaxing and only served to fill me with anticipation of what was to come. sun,swimming, lazing by the pool all day, plenty of available refeshments just a few short steps from my cabana poolside ,to the bar ,where you would be served almost anything your heart desires, witha smile i might add! and if that wasnt enough, a free wine tasting in the lobby at 5pm each evening was there for the taking. beautiful surroundings, relaxing atmosphere, whats not to love? i hope to be able to return to solamar in the near future and enjoy a repeat performance. thank you for helping to make the big 5 o a positive one. lili in tucson

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Zacloed1
Reviews.Content: Great place - clean and friendly. This is a pet friendly hotel - so we brought along our dog. Petco park is 1 block down and they have a leash-free dog park which was great for free-time and potty-time for our doggie. The pool was heated and nice. Not a ton of seating - but enough to get by. Seems like a younger crowd when we were there, but everyone was friendly and loved our toddler. They have a complimentary wine hour in the evening and coffee in the morning. Overall - a great stay. Right in downtown - close to EVERYTHING - especially the stadium if you go for a Padres game.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Restaurant and Nice Outdoor bar”
Reviews.Author: Borntotravel2
Reviews.Content: Normally we avoid hotel restaurants but hearing good reviews we gave it a try. It was nothing short of exceptional! If you don't go to JSix you're missing out. Hotel is nicely done, rooms are comtemporary and it's a matter of taste. Free internet and complimenary wine are nice features. The pool and bar area with the firepits is a nice touch....very cosmopolitian in feel.

Reviews.Title: “Solamar is perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Dixie_in_UK
Reviews.Content: I arrived from London tired, dirty and braindead. I was in San Diego for a meeting and was booked into the nearby Omni for all but the first night. Lucky me that I had one night in the Solamar! Check in was easy-peasy and was upgraded to a luxury room (just because!). The room was wonderful - bedding comfortable, bathroom spacious, and the (free) wireless was superfast. The next morning I ordered breakfast from room service (egg white omelet with spinach and mushrooms) and it was quick and delicious. Check out was simple and they even pointed the way to the Omni down the street (the Omni was perfectly fine... but paled in comparison to the Solamar).

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, Not Quite Great”
Reviews.Author: Spamstan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Solamar for a work meeting. I am a Kimpton fan and was looking forward to checking out a new (for me) property. My assessment - Solamar is good, but a little shy of great. The front desk staff was quite friendly during check in, which was first thing in the morning (while I was trying to listen to a conference call). Quick and efficient. And later quite helpful when I needed to print out my boarding pass for the next morning (see below). My room was nice, not unexpected nor dissimilar from other Kimptons. Free wireless, which was actually fast. Overall good space for working and relaxing. And an ourdoor seating area to boot. Public space was fine. We had a group dinner by the pool (which is on the 4th floor), which was great. Nice, though partially blocked, views. Attentive service. Food was even good. So why not great? A few nits: My room was right by the pool bar, which was loud until around midnight. Probably my fault for not asking to be moved. The workout room was 24 hour access, but one needed to be let in before 7 am. Why? "Security reasons", although the room is on the 4th floor. And I managed to lock myself outside after my workout, requiring me to find a side elevator and reenter the hotel via the restaurant because there are no phones outside. I went into the business center to print my boarding pass. They wanted $12 to access the Internet, even though wireless is free throughout the hotel. Again, the front desk staff was more than happy to comply. Morning coffee service (6 am in the lobby) never appeared. I would stay there again. In fact debating booking a room for the family so we can see a Padres game this summer as well as play in one of our favorite California big cities. But I'd go in knowing what the downsides are.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Aurorabo
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I planned a girls' weekend in SD and we enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much. The only glitch was that I had called in advance to request a room with double beds and the receptionist confirmed, but when we checked in the following day they said that if you book through hotwire you only get the option of a room with a king bed. The hotel is nicely decorated and very clean. It is a non-smoking hotel. We don't like pets but pets are allowed at this hotel, they have managed to keep it very clean and odor-free. Our room was very clean and also nicely decorated. And the very best of all, they have a nightly wine hour with your choice of red or white wine. Location is great. The immediate surrounding area isn't really pretty..a parking lot and some empty commerical buildings but within walking distance to Gaslamp, the Marina, the ball park, and Horton Plaza. Plenty of restuarants and bars near by to keep you entertained.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but...”
Reviews.Author: moncherrie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The staff was very nice and accommodating. However, when you pay this much money for a hotel, they should not charge you for internet access or to make copies in the business center. Besides not having soda machines. I do not care how wealthy you are, no one in their right mind is going to pay $5 for a Coca Cola or a bottle of water.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, surprisingly kid friendly, hip funky decor”
Reviews.Author: ValueSeekerRW
Reviews.Content: Via Hotwire, I booked 2 rooms for one night during the President's Day weekend. The rate was $139/night...and I was initially a bit apprehensive about this being the hotel revealed. It looked very adult-oriented and the reviews have tended to reflect this opinion...and we had two families with one pre-schooler apiece. There wasn't even a mention of cribs being available on the website---although a lot of cool services available for dogs were highlighted. I wrote the property via their website to inquire about the cribs. I quickly received a voice mail message from a very nice man who assured me that they had cribs and to call if I had any questions or further requests. And thus began an amazing experience with the Hotel Solamar's customer service from every single employee we dealt with---from the front desk check-in to the cleaning people we saw in the hall. Everyone seems genuinely delighted to see you and eager to offer recommendations on how to make your stay in the hotel and the area more enjoyable. And bear in mind our party had two almost 3-year old boys in tow (enough to make most people head for the hills). Parents will appreciate how one host named Gordie got down to my son's level, really listened and had a nice conversation with him, and then greeted him by name whenever he saw him. Each child was also presented with a little goody bag of toys, including a thoughtful pre-soaped, duck-shaped sponge that made bathtime a real treat. When the crib was delivered, it was already assembled and was made up with sheets---this in itself is rather unusual! The rooms are a little small, but very well decorated in a hip, modern style. Even the bathrobes are funky----zebra and leopard skin patterned terry cloth! Hilarious! Our bellman who delivered our luggage also kindly pointed out that the honor bar doesn't have those annoying sensors that charge your room if any of the fridge contents get moved---so if you can refrigerate a few small items of your own. The one slight service gaffe was that there was no honor bar key in our room, and it took about half an hour for them to locate an extra one. It seems that most people who get rooms via a discount website get placed on the 4th floor which is the same floor as their pool and poolside bar. The front desk lady was proactive in giving us our rooms facing away from the pool to limit our exposure to DJ noise (seeing as we had young kids), but there was some hallway rowdiness from partygoers entering/leaving the pool area. Nothing terrible though, and the pool closes at 9. The hotel's restaurant JSix is gorgeously appointed, and serves delicious breakfast for a surprisingly reasonable price! Try the Chilaquiles which are amazing! Again, the wait staff were extremely gracious and accommodating to young children. A couple blocks away, the excellent restaurant Basics serves just pizza and salad---but oh, what pizza and salad! The other family vacationing with us originally hail from New York, and they proclaimed it the best pizza they've had on the West Coast. Another great recommendation from the front desk! The location is excellent, only a a few miles away from the San Diego zoo---and a far, far better choice than staying at one of the places on Hotel Circle (especially if you can get a Priceline or Hotwire deal). We will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room!”
Reviews.Author: Spicey477
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Solamar and really enjoyed it. The room itself was beautiful, gorgeous colors of blue and really nice furniture. The bathroom was fabulous with a large jacuzzi tub and separate shower. The bathroom is partially open to the rest of the room with a large door that can be pulled shut or open depending on privacy. Privacy wasn't an issue, but it was a bit noisy when someone was taking a shower and the other was sleeping. The hotel has a free wine tasting in the early evening, but we never made a point to go because we were always out and my husband went on the first day and said that the wine wasn't that great to go back for more. They have free Starbucks and Tazo tea in the morning from 7-9am. My husband had breakfast in the hotel restaurant one day and thought it was quite overpriced, but many are so that isn't rare. The staff was friendly, but not overbearing and I did see the housekeeping staff a lot and they were super friendly. The parking rate was high, at $30/day and before we went, I had called to see if there were any other garages or lots around the hotel. The person who answered said that they were, but they didn't know how much. Well, they are around the $10/day range, depending on when you put your car in the garage. Overall, it is a very nice hotel in a nice location walking distance to the ballpark, convention center and the Gaslamp District, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and Great Food”
Reviews.Author: Joe_D123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just one night to celebrate my wife's birthday and had such a good experience. Our porter found out it was my wife's birthday and after delivering our luggage, promptly returned with complementary champaign! It was very good champaign too. The concierge welcomed us with a plate of trail mixes and bottles of water. And he made special arrangements at the restaurant at jSix (located in the hotel). We were given more champaign, special appetizers, and desert. I was most impressed because we didn't ask for any of this and it was all complementary. Everyone we saw working at the hotel greeted us with a smile and they were all friendly. The food at jSix was fantastic. Easily worth twice as much as they charge. The room was clean and comfortable. Even the weather cooperated and the rain stopped for our visit. I would highly recommend this hotel and any Kimpton property. They always seem to go out of their way to make the visit a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: michbren
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at this hotel and could not have had a more enjoyable experience. We always try to stay at a Kimpton hotel if the city we are traveling to has one and this is one of their better properties for ambiance, quality and outstanding service. It is certainly a beautiful hotel. Having read some past negative reviews I was somewhat apprehensive but either the reviews were wrong or the hotel has greatly improved. Check-in went well, our room was perfect, our stay was without any problems and check-out was easy. The hotel atmosphere is very relaxing and lends itself to having a great time. The wine hour was enjoyable and two of the evenings the manager circulated the room to make sure the guests were pleased with the hotel. Housekeeping did an excellent job each day and never caused us an inconvenience. Every staff member was great. We tried the hotel restaurant for breakfast and it was excellent. Went to the fourth floor outdoor bar. The area was nice but it was too cold to stay. The fitness room was so-so - not very big with limited equipment. The location of the Hotel Solamar is convenient to both the Gaslamp District and the Convention Center area. Public transportation is nearby and the city bus to the airport is a few steps outside the hotel. We took it back to the airport and it took about thirlty minutes. We would definitely stay at this hotel should we visit San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, great location”
Reviews.Author: GogginDE
Reviews.Content: Possibly the best service I've ever received at a hotel. The front desk staff was as friendly and accomodating as could be, as was the rest of the staff. We Pricelined this hotel, and they were still very accomodating about providing a room on highest floor possible,away from any possible street or nightlife noise. I think it helped that it was December, and hotel was probably not near capacity. My one complaint was the pricing for the parking and for the J-Bar (outside bar on 4th floor). $30/night plus tip for valet parking is excessive. Then I ordered 2 glasses of house wine from J-Bar, at $9/glass for the house wine - again, seems excessive for house wine. But with great location of this hotel, there's so many other options available that it wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Solamar-- doesnt get better than this!!”
Reviews.Author: scohel1
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the Hotel Solamar for a three-day long (Dec. 6-9, 2007) anniversary trip. Actually, booked the Hotel Solamar via Price-line and was our first time to a Kimpton Hotel-- it will certainly not be the last. What's not to like about this hotel? Great location--1-2 blocks to The Gaslamp District, 3 blocks to Petco Park, 4-5 blocks to convention center. Friendly, helpful people working at the Hotel-- From the men at Valet (and yes $30 per night is expensive, but that's the going rate), to the Bellman who gave us recommendations to restaurants and clubs, the Concierge who made reservations for us, to the Front Desk - who upon hearing this was a special trip for us-- possibly up-graded us to a corner room King w/spa tub. Everyone working at the Hotel Solamar was fantastic. The Amenities-- modern, well-appointed rooms, very comfortable bed. Clean. No issue with noise or house-keeping. And the crazy Zebra and Tiger bathrobes, we loved it. Nightly Happy Hour from 5-6pm, red wine and/or champagne. Tough decisions to make!! Checked out the J-Bar on the fourth floor only briefly (too cold/rain), but it seemed like a happening place (I can only imagine the summer-time). Didn't make it to JSix restaurant--too many options close by-- but seemed elegant. In closing, our experience at the Hotel Solamar was First-rate. Comfortable-clean room, great location, first-class staff. Doesn't get better than this!!

Reviews.Title: “San Diego: Convient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JRMKentucky
Reviews.Content: Hotel Solamar had a great location in the Gas Lamp District. It was close walk (3 blocks or less) to the convention center and many restaurants and shops in the area. A longer walk (5 to 6 blocks) gets you to the seaside village and Midway aircraft carrier. Beware of the falsely advertised seafood restaurant Anthony's in that area. It was average at best. The hotel featured a nice wine tasting each night in the lobby. It had a fun and relaxed feeling as people interacted in the comfortable setting. The JSix restaurant was delicious and had a lovely atmosphere. The fresh squeezed juices, though adding to the cost of breakfast, were wonderful. Finally, the roof top bar was most pleasant during the wonderful San Diego evenings. I rated this hotel above average only because the room was a bit small, though nicely decorated and quite comfortable with nice linens and matresses. We received the New York Times every morning, and any requests we made were promptly and courteously addressed. Dogs are welcomed at the hotel, but they were never a problem or too numerous. (There were none that I saw during the week, with ony three during the weekend.) I highly recommend this lovely hotel for your stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: batravellerToronto
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through the website and received a really good rate off $147 per night. The hotel is in a great area, the furnishings are mordern and the staff is extremely helpful. We also had dinner at the hotel restaurant J-six which was also excellent. Just wished we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Rendez-Vous ruined :(”
Reviews.Author: maranna4life
Reviews.Content: I booked a surprise get away for my fiencee and I. We were in need of a nice getaway following Thanksgiving. When finding the Hotel Solomar and checking out the website it seemed cool enough with this kind of peaceful, serenity vibe. Even had yoga chick looking ultra relaxed. The picture showed a nice dÃ©cor, a bit trendy and then I saw a special for â€œRomantic Rendezvousâ€�. Perfect! The special was to include cold champagne waiting our arrival, chocolate truffles on our bed, and bed and breakfast.yummy! Sounds pretty romantic eh? Oh but NO. Once we got there, the bubbly but unhelpful reservation woman informed us that we did not have the â€œRomantic Rendezvousâ€� special and instead had some other promotion. Huh? We donâ€™t want another special. I paid for romance so I expect romance dammit! Soon the manager (I guess) sensing a little trouble tried to help saying he would â€œlook into it and let us know if the morningâ€�. Let us know in the morning? That too late! We want our breakfast in bed so this needed to be taken care of right now. Later we got a call that because of the confusion (in which there was no â€œconfusionâ€�), they would credit us $50 for room service (More on this in a second). But what about our champagne? What about our truffles? At least a Snickers bar or something! A bit about the hotel: Actually, in all fairness, itâ€™s not that bad. The location is nice in that it is walking distance to the popular Gas lamp district with lots of shopping and restaurants. The dÃ©cor was pretty funky, no complaints. The room was nice although small. We were warned about all the noise we would receive since the bar and pool is in the center of the hotel. Hopefully, it was just a bad week for them on this Friday and Saturday night, because there may have been seven people max (2 were bartendersâ€¦and 1 bar back). So, huh, noise was not an issue. Probably our favorite part was their complimentary wine hour where the guests can mingle in a pretty cool lounge/sitting area and if nothing else, look cool. More importantly, we found this a time to cash in on our missing romantic package, so we helped ourselves to refills oh about every 10 minutes, â€œborrowedâ€� the wine glasses (theyâ€™re in our cupboard right now) and proceeded to purposely get very buzzed and well, romantic! In passing the front desk, another cheery unhelpful reservation girl asked if there was anything she could do for me. Well yesâ€¦give us some champagne! I explained once again how they screwed us out of our romantic package and quite possibly jeopardized our chances of an everlasting marriage. I should sue! She said she would send up a bottle of Champagne. Ok, now weâ€™re getting somewhere. Not even 5 minutes later, they call the room saying they out of champagne. $&*&^! â€“ WTF, how can a hotel be fresh out of champagne. Especially an EMPTY hotel?? Instead we got another bottle of the wine we had already abused earlier. Great. So that evening get ready for our ghetto breakfast in bed with our $50 credit for room service breakfast due to â€œconfusionâ€�. So we decide on eggs some bacon, toast, a bagel, lox and cheese. With delivery charge, tax, and gratuityâ€¦.$47!!! Double WTF? Another nice thing was that the Hotel Solomar was pet friendly, so we brought our cute little dog, Pepper along. Even he was unhappy as he got attacked by two stray pit bulls in the Gas lamp District. So, considering everything, upon checking out we let him poop on the front lawn (and didnâ€™t pick it upâ€¦J/K wink) â€“ Still, this is about how we felt about their â€œRomantic Rendezvousâ€�â€¦it was crap. The Hotel Solomar is actually a decent place to stay. I think the main problem is marketing it as something it is not. No, you will not have romance there (although the free wine hour helps). You will not find a happening bar filled with drunken chicks. You will not find a real yoga retreat. You will not find a spacious room. You will get an average to slightly above average place to rest your head with a touch of style. Make sure you get a cheap special otherwise if you pay more you are more likely to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sbgr
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Solamar for a few nights in November 2007, with great pleasure. The room on the 9th floor was very clean, luxurious and spacious. It was extremely quiet in the hotel so I slept very very well in the kingsize bed. I did not use the rooftop pool/bar but it looked very nice. The hotel's location is very convenient as well, 5 mins walking to the convention center; all the bars and restaurants of the Gaslamp quarter in about 1 min walking distance. The hotel is located at the border of the Gaslamp quarter therefore the area is quiet at night. Every morning free (good!) coffee and thea, and free wine from 17h-18h. On my departure date I used the MTS bus service directly to the airport, which stops right in front of the hotel. Very convenient and cost only $2.25, thus saved my quite some $$ on taxi. If I ever return to San Diego I certainly would love to stay in Solamar.

Reviews.Title: “Great location beautiful decor can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: elana25
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Solamar is in a great location with beautiful decor. The pool is located on the 4th floor. There is a bar with loud music by the pool. If you have to get to bed early or need quiet, the rooms on the pool side or probably not a good choice for the weekends. I stayed on the 8th floor on the pool side and could hear some of the music beat but not enough to keep me awake. The staff was very friendly. The hotel allows pets, even large dogs, so if you're allergic, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: Kamtini
Reviews.Content: Kimptons are great hotels because they represent a different approach from the cookie-cutter high-end chain norm. I have stayed at several and the Solamar is better than average. It has a fantastic pool/outside bar area complete with firepits and wonderful drinks (I highly recommend the pear martini). Even if you don't stay here, it should not be missed. The room, however, was just okay - better than a usual chain but not as good as others within the Kimpton brand. There is a really strange white shabby chic mirror that is aesthetically jarring and out of scale with the rest of the interior. (I had read about this mirror on TripAdvisor prior to going and it was true). The room service food was terrible and over-priced. I sent my original order back and its replacement was not much better - the hotel was gracious enough to take it off the bill. The restaurants in the area, however, were fantastic (if you like Thai, Rama is a lovely restaurant with excellent food) This review is a bit of a conundrum for me - while I appreciated the Solamar's uniqueness, I was in San Diego for business and perhaps I was not quite in the mindset for what is clearly a trendy boutique hotel - I would definitely recommend it for the younger, affluent, traveller who wants to be close to the action but doubt I would stay there for business again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Solamar is Not to Be Missed”
Reviews.Author: DCflyboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and to be experienced. It is one of the very creative Kimpton hotels -- the difference here (as explained by the staff) is that this hotel was built from the ground up instead of being a rehab in cool old buildings like most Kimptons. The result is a super-cool pool on the fourth floor that has a cocktail lounge that goes late -- it was crowded every night and fun to watch from my hotel room or to join. Outside firepits by the pool really give a great ambience for cocktails with friends. The rooms are very funky, functional, and fun. It is located near a lot of activities downtown. The staff are friendly and helpful. Kimptons are boutique hotels and a nice break from big chains when you want high class and comfort in a smaller setting. The two criticisms of the Solamar are (1) it seems inconsistent that they would charge for web access -- a hotel of this class should provide it free, and (2) their frequent stayer program is VAGUE -- they simply notice how often you stay and then award you with awards. I much prefer getting points and seeing them add up, such as a Hilton or Marriott program.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tymp
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel at $105 through Priceline. Location was great and many great restaurants are within walking distance. The other major hotels (e.g. Marriot, Omni) are just couple of blocks away. We parked our car in the next block (which has a big "PARK" sign, after the Marriot hotel) for $8. This rate is applicable only when you enter the car park after 6pm, and they only charged us a max of $8 even though we collected our car as late as 11am the next day. We thought that was a good rate to park in the city. Hotel valet parking was $30! Room decor is modern, with comfortable bed. However, my husband did not quite like the mirror in front of the bed, which he thinks causes nightmares throughout the night. We did not encounter any problems with the service. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We were provided with a room not facing the pool, as requested, after reading the previous reviews. We did go down to the open bar at the pool area on 4th floor, which we thought was a really nice area for chilling out. Great views and nice environment!! (See pic attached). Oh yes, we also like the free wines served from 5-6pm every day at the lounge. We will definitely recommend the hotel to others and we will return again!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy execution of details!”
Reviews.Author: CSBSCValencia
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here, September 23-25. Never again! I had read all the reviews about the noise from the 4th floor pool area and called in advance to be moved to a higher floor facing Petco Stadium. That solved one problem, but many more surfaced. The minibar had been emptied at the request of another guest with the same last name and was never restocked even though I requested it. I call for a late night snack when I checked in on Sunday and room service could not tell me if they had any ice cream left, BUT if they did someone would bring it to me in 45-50 minutes. What they could have done is said if there is ice cream I will call you back and let you know, instead, they left me hanging for 40 minutes not knowing. They brought me ice cream; the knock on the door was a surpise...not how I want desert brought to me. I left dry cleaning on Monday mornng and though it was supposed to be returned at 6pm or so, there was a knock on my door at 10:30 that night with the delivery. Before I went to bed on Monday night I called for a 5:30am wakeup call and they phone rang at 5am, a full half hour early. I dropped by the desk on Tuesday night when I returned from dinner and asked for a 5:30am call and it never came. I returned from my business meeting on Tuesday afternoon to my floor and when the elevator door opened, there was a horrible smell throughout the area. I called downstairs to get some attention on this and nothing had changed when I left for dinner an hour later and when I returned four hours later. I believe that this hotel caters to people in their 20s and 30s who do not mind poor service, failure to execute and do not have any level of attention to detail. While this is a chain hotel to some extent, it lacks the policies and procedures that a chain in this price range should have instiutied. Would I stay here again: I would rather sleep in my car. Would I recommend it to anyone: No.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty to look at... and that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Courtesy_Flush
